hortatrix: <entryFree id="n20984" type="main" key="horta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that incites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourages</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">exhorts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda hortatrix voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Trag. Fragm. v. 195" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Trag. Fragm. v. 195</bibl></cit> Rib.: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria hortatrix animosi leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:717" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa velut hortatrix manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortatus: <entryFree id="n20985" type="main" key="horta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encouragement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhortation</hi> (in class. prose only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec vox hujus hortatu praeceptisque conformata, nonnullis aliquando saluti fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum consilio, hortatu, auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum omnium hortatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 317</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatus laudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:67" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 67</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:550" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 550</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:81 al" default="NO">4, 81 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hortensianus: <entryFree id="n20986" type="main" key="Hortensi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortensĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. Hortensius, II. B.</entryFree>
hortensis: <entryFree id="n20987" type="main" key="hortensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hortus</etym>, <sense id="n20987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1626</bibl></cit>: IOVIS, Inscr. ap. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 390.</sense></entryFree>
hortensius: <entryFree id="n20988" type="main" key="hortensi^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortensĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20988.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 40, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">batis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 50, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20988.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">horten-sia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">garden-herbs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:131" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 39, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 4, 10, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20989" type="main" key="Hortensi^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortensĭus</orth> (HORTÉSIVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 235</bibl>, <gen>n.</gen> 619), <sense id="n20989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in partic.: Q. Hortensius Hortalus,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated orator in the time of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:27" default="NO">12, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl>. After him is named the treatise of Cicero entitled Hortensius, of which fragments remain (Bait. XI. 55 sqq.).—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortensĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his daughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also celebrated for her skill in oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20989.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20989.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortensĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Hortensius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hortensian</hi>: lex, <hi rend="ital">of the dictator</hi> Q. Hortensius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>.—Another lex Hortensia (ut nundinae essent fastae), perh. of the same Hortensius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20989.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortensĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Hortensian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: quod me admones, ut scribam illa Hortensiana, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the treatise entitled</hi> Hortensius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aedibus Hortensianis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortesius: <entryFree id="n20990" type="main" key="Horte_sius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortēsius</orth>, v. 2. Hortensius <sense id="n20990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hortinus: <entryFree id="n20991" type="main" key="Horti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hortīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Hortanum.</entryFree>
hortor: <entryFree id="n20992" type="main" key="hortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi> hortarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 5</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>for horitor, v. horior</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to urge one strongly</hi> to do a thing, <hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhort</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: moneo, admoneo, suadeo). </sense><sense id="n20992.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, with the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de aliqua re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20992.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hacc, quae supra scripta sunt, eo spectant, ut te horter et suadeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: neque nos hortari neque dehortari decet Hominem peregrinum,<cb n="HORT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terribiles hortatus equos,</quote> <trans><tr>spurring on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex in culina clamat: hortatur cocos: Quin agitis hodie?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortari coepit eundem Verbis, quae timido quoque possent addere mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20992.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laudem milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad curam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad diligentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quaerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad reliqua fortius exsequenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paribus Messapum in proelia dictis Hortatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam jungendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 19, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20992.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">De aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem de rebus etiam atque etiam hortor, quibus superioribus litteris hortatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Aufidiano nomine nihil te hortor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de concilianda pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20992.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium et hortari et orare ... ut magnam infamiam fugiat, non desistemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit atque hortatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse equo circumiens unumquemque nominans appellat, hortatur, rogat, uti meminerint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno opere te hortor, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vos hortari tantum possum, ut amicitiam omnibus rebus humanis anteponatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes ut illam ire viam pergant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te sedulo Et moneo et hortor, ne cujusquam misereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorix in Nervios pervenit hortaturque, ne sui in perpetuum liberandi occasionem dimittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur eos, ne animo deficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—With the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labienum Treboniumque hortatur ... ad eam diem revertantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego vos, de vestro impendatis, hortor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur et monet, imitetur vicinum suum Octavium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquid</hi> or simply <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin tu (quod te jamdudum hortor) exieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: trepidus hortabar fugam, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem pacem hortari non desino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pacem amicitiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miseram! cupio non persuadere quod hortor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 187</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cum legati hortarentur accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Daedalus) dedit oscula nato, Hortaturque sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Chariclem medicum) remanere ac recumbere hortatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit> (cf. in the foll. b.).—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego vos ultum injurias hortor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortor, asto, admoneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sigambri fuga comparata, hortantibus iis, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortante et jubente Vercingetorige,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 4 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n20992.6" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. or abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">pol benefacta tua me hortantur, tuo ut imperio paream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: res, tempus, locus, simul otium hortabatur, ut, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 523, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae res ad hoc consilium Gallos hortabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum ea multae res eum hortabantur, quare sibi eam rem cogitandam et suscipiendam putaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rei publicae dignitas) me ad sese rapit, haec minora relinquere hortatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20992.7" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">hortari currentem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to urge one who needs no urging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 45, 2</bibl>; v. curro. —</sense><sense id="n20992.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to exhort</hi> soldiers before a battle: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus suos hortatus cupientibus signum dat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca pro tempore milites hortatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos hortando ad virtutem arrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 207</bibl>.!*? </sense><sense id="n20992.9" n="a" level="4"> Also in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">horto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:554" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 554</bibl> Vahl.; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> hortavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 5:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20992.10" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hortor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>: ab amicis hortaretur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 1</bibl>: hoste hortato, Auct. B. Hisp. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hortualis: <entryFree id="n20993" type="main" key="hortu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hortus</etym>, <sense id="n20993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden</hi>- (post-class. for hortensis): <cit><quote lang="la">species strychni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinaca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herpillos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortulanus: <entryFree id="n20994" type="main" key="hortu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hortulus</etym>, <sense id="n20994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden</hi>- (postclass.<cb n="HOSP" />  for hortensis). </sense><sense id="n20994.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimusque secessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stuffed with garden-herbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7:section=384" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7, § 384</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20994.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hortulanus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a gardener</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 235 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hortulus: <entryFree id="n20995" type="main" key="hortu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hortus</etym>, <sense id="n20995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little garden.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20995.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:226" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 105</bibl>; as <hi rend="ital">part of a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortuli,</quote> <trans><tr>garden-grounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20995.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: Cupidinis, i. e. pudenda muliebria, App. <foreign lang="greek">*)anex</foreign>. 17.—</sense><sense id="n20995.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Democriti) fontibus Epicurus hortulos suos irrigavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hortus: <entryFree id="n20996" type="main" key="hortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hortus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf.: heres, co-hors; <foreign lang="greek">xo/rtos</foreign>, an enclosure for plants; hence</etym>, <sense id="n20996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pleasure - garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruit - garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kitchen - garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vineyard</hi> (syn.: pomarium, viretum, viridarium). </sense><sense id="n20996.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed is clam patrem etiam hac nocte illa per hortum transiit ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abii ad hortum nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 15</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">horti Epicuri,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Epicurus taught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 23, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni Senecae praedivitis horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>: Horti Caesaris, Agrippinae, Domitiae, etc., <hi rend="ital">at Rome</hi> (Trans-Tiberim); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker's Antiq. I. p. 657 sq.: Horti Maecenatis,</quote> <trans><tr>on the Esquiline hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:page=540 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 540 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20996.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20996.3" n="A" level="2"> For villa, <hi rend="ital">a country-seat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in XII. tabulis legum nostrarum nusquam nominatur villa, semper in significatione ea hortus, in horti vero heredium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20996.4" n="B" level="2"> For holera, <hi rend="ital">garden-stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vegetables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20996.5" n="C" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kh=pos</foreign>, i. q. pudendum muliebre, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. I. p. 686 Burm.; also the <hi rend="ital">posteriors</hi> of a boy, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
horus: <entryFree id="n20997" type="main" key="Ho_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*(=wros</foreign>, <sense id="n20997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of the sun among the Egyptians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hospes: <entryFree id="n20998" type="main" key="hospe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype> (<sense id="n20998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> hospitium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 4</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. antistita from antistes, sospita from sospes, sacerdota from sacerdos, etc., but <itype>hospes</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 279, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Trag. Fragm. v. 51 Rib.: hospes amica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:510" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:272" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 318 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 318 al.</bibl>) [= hostipets, hostis, a stranger; pa-, root of pasco, pater, to feed, hence], </sense><sense id="n20998.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who entertains a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a host</hi> (one who entertains gratuitously, as a friend: caupo, one who entertains for pay); <cit><quote lang="la">form hospes: alterum ad cauponem devertisse, ad hospitem alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendimus hinc recta Beneventum, ubi sedulus hospes Paene macros, arsit, dum turdos versat in igne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitis affectu salutare,</quote> <trans><tr>with a host's politeness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 161</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">one upon whom soldiers are quartered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 41</bibl>.—Hence repeated of both host and guest: <cit><quote lang="la">per dexteram istam te oro, quam regi Deiotaro hospes hospiti porrexisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non hospes ab hospite tutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, = hospitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 224</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, hospita, <hi rend="ital">she who entertains a guest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hostess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina primaria, Servilia, vetere Dionis hospita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura et lineamenta hospitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">89: Helene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—In late Lat., for <hi rend="ital">a concubine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2669</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4996</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20998.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20998.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sojourner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ce/nos</foreign>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo clari hominis, in quam et hospites multi recipiendi et admittenda hominum cujusque modi multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri inter Cratippi commentarios tamquam hospites recipiendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere hospites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere hospitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hospites, sed peregrini atque advenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuisses non hospitem, sed contubernalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et hostem et hospitem vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is qui nuper Romae fuit Menedemus hospes meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polybius noster hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id factum ex suis hospitibus Caesar cognoverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suos notos hospitesque quaerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 74, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes familiae vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: homo multorum<pb n="867" /> <cb n="HOSP" />  hospitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi seu longum post tempus venerat hospes Sive, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vespertinus subito te oppresserit hospes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospite venturo, cessabit nemo tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 59</bibl></cit>: in officiis apud majores ita observatum est: primum tutelae, deinde hospiti, deinde clienti, tum cognato, postea adfini, Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 5</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meamne hic in via hospitam, Quae heri huc Athenis cum hospite advenit meo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20998.4" n="B" level="2"> Opp. to a native, <hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreigner</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">advena, peregrinus, peregrinator, alienus): adeone hospes hujusce urbis, adeone ignarus es disciplinae consuetudinisque nostrae, ut haec nescias?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec peregrinus atque hospes in agendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos in nostra urbe peregrinantes errantesque tamquam hospites tui libri quasi domum deduxerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—So in addressing a foreigner, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ce/ne</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">stranger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Theophrastus) percontaretur ex anicula quadam, quanti aliquid venderet, et respondisset illa atque addidisset, Hospes, non pote minoris: tulisse eum moleste, se non effugere hospitis speciem, cum aetatem ageret Athenis optimeque loqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl>: dic, hospes, Spartae, nos te hic vidisse jacentes, Cic. poët. Tusc. 1, 42, 101 (a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)=w cei=n), a)gge/llein *aakedaimoni/ois</foreign>, etc., Herod. 7, 228): hospes, quid miras curare Serapin? Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, hospita, <hi rend="ital">a female stranger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc hospitam crepidula ut graphice decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20998.5" n="C" level="2"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi> in any matter, <hi rend="ital">ignorant of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si erit idem in consuetudine civitatis hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos ignoretis, vos hospites in hac urbe versamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20998.6" n="D" level="2"> Of inanim. or abstr. things adjectively, <hi rend="ital">hospitable; strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20998.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Form hospes (only in post-Aug. poets): gemma, Pall. Insit. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:479" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:252" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 5, 1, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 650</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20998.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Form hospita (in the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): hirundines hospitae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:340" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tutior hospita lustres Aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunx hospita Teucris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra hospita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:650" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:842" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 842</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 3, 5, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda plaustris,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing wagons on its frozen surface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:44" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hospita: <entryFree id="n20999" type="main" key="hospi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭta</orth>, v. hospes.</entryFree>
hospitaculum: <entryFree id="n21000" type="main" key="hospi^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtācŭlum</orth>,, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hospita</etym>, <sense id="n21000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lodging-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitalis: <entryFree id="n21001" type="main" key="hospi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hospes</etym>, <sense id="n21001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a guest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hospitable</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ce/nios, ceniko/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n21001.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21001.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illam ipsam sedem hospitalem, in quam erit deductus, publicam populi Romani esse dicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deversorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <trans><tr>guest-chamber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>set before a guest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cena Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 24, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tessera,</quote> <trans><tr>which guests gave to the host</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:87 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 87 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>the patron of hospitality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 3 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitavit illud insigne Penatium hospitaliumque deorum ex hospitali mensa tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>: fulmina, <hi rend="ital">of Jupiter</hi> hospitalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <trans><tr>the murder of a guest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">TABVLA,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a municipal decree for the reception of a guest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 456, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theophrastus scribit, Cimonem Athenis etiam in suos curiales Laciadas hospitalem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo qui semper hospitalissimus amicissimusque nostrorum hominum existimatus esset (shortly before: cum suae partes essent hospitum recipiendorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua illa Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi hospitale pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hospitalius mari (Campaniae): hospitalem hostem appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illi nobiles portus Cajeta, Misenus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appulsus litorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 46, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21001.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n21001.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a guest</hi>: injuriae potestatum in hospitales ad visendum venientium, Hipponenses in necem ejus (delphini)<cb n="HOSP" />  compulerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21001.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n21001.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Apartments for guests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guest-chambers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21001.7" n="b" level="4"> On the stage, <hi rend="ital">the two entrances on the right and left for strangers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21001.8" n="c" level="4"> (Sc. jura.) <hi rend="ital">The dues of hospitality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n21001.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: ut in Fucino lacu invectus amnis, in Lario Addua, etc. ... in Lemanno Rhodanus: hic trans Alpes superiores in Italia multorum milium transitu hospitales suas tantum nec largiores quam intulere aquas evehentes, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that flow through without mingling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:69" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 10, 14, § 69</bibl>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hospitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a guest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitati hospitaliter per domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare (opp. hostiliter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi ad deos Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitalitas: <entryFree id="n21002" type="main" key="hospi^ta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hospitalis</etym>. <sense id="n21002.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hospitality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte etiam a Theophrasto est laudata hospitalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 28</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n21002.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being a guest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a living in a foreign country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sojourning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege temporalis hospitalitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 21, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitaliter: <entryFree id="n21003" type="main" key="hospi^ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hospitalis <sense id="n21003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hospitator: <entryFree id="n21004" type="main" key="hospi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hospitor</etym>, <sense id="n21004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lodger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei hospitatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hospiticida: <entryFree id="n21005" type="gloss" key="hospi^ti^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtĭcīda</orth> <foreign lang="greek">cenokto/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Phil.</entryFree>
hospitiolum: <entryFree id="n21006" type="main" key="hospi^ti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hospitium</etym>, <sense id="n21006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little inn</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 47, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">108, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitium: <entryFree id="n21007" type="main" key="hospi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>hospes</etym>. <sense id="n21007.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hospitality</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego universos adhiberi liberaliter, optimum quemque hospitio amicitiaque conjungi dico oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quocum mihi amicitiam res publica conciliavit, hospitium voluntas utriusque conjunxit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia atque hospitiis florens hominum nobilissimorum ... cum Metellis, erat ei hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro hospitio quod sibi cum eo esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus hospitium renovare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic hospitium habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hospitio Ariovisti usus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungimus hospitio dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulge hospitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut artum solveret hospitiis animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic paternum hospitium cum Pompeio intercedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernunt, ut cum L. fratre hospitium publice fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaditani hospitium cum L. Cornelio publice fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice privatimque hospitia jungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientelae hospitiaque provincialia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21007.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hospitable reception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertainment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in Arpinati videbimus et hospitio agresti accipiemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab eo magnificentissimo hospitio acceptus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitio invitabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic apud me hospitium tibi praebebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alibi te meliust quaerere hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me excepit Aricia hospitio modico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens hospitio deorum inmortalium sancta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21007.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a place of entertainment</hi> for strangers, <hi rend="ital">a lodging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guest-chamber</hi> (cf. diversorium): <cit><quote lang="la">ex vita ita discedo tamquam ex hospitio, non tamquam ex domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piliae paratum est hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deductus a magistratibus in nemorosum hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 38, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi (milites) benigne excepti divisique in hospitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hospitium imperatoris venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitia singulorum adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorianae cohortes per hospitia dispersae,</quote> <trans><tr>the townquarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae ... magno hospitium miserabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitio aliquem juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 211</bibl></cit>: hospitio prohibemur harenae, <hi rend="ital">of the shore</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">from landing</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 540</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">itque pecus longa in deserta sine ullis Hospitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 343</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 66</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciam nunc, si tresviri me in carcerem compegerint? ... ita Peregre adveniens hospitio publicitus accipiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certe advenientem hic me hospitio pugneo accepturus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 140</bibl></cit>: nec <cb n="HOST" /> confidentiae usquam hospitium est, nec de verticulum dolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ut universi intellegant, sacrosanctum cunctis esse debere hospitium virilis animae, i. e. virile corpus, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 3, 2.</sense></entryFree>
hospitivus: <entryFree id="n21008" type="hapax" key="hospi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hospes</etym>, <sense id="n21008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a host</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridaria,</quote> <trans><tr>his host's</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitor: <entryFree id="n21009" type="main" key="hospi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n21009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be a guest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lodge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourn as a guest</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n21009.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mensores postibus hospitaturi nomen ascribunt, Cod. Th. 7, 8, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21009.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. hospitalis, II.): Gangem in quodam lacu hospitari; <cit><quote lang="la">inde lenem fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 18, 22, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castanea translata nescit hospitari pavetque novitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21009.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aliud voces animum quam deum in humano corpore hospitantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hospitus: <entryFree id="n21010" type="main" key="hospi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hospĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, occurring only in the <sense id="n21010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem. sing.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> hospita; v. hospes.</sense></entryFree>
hostia: <entryFree id="n21011" type="main" key="hosti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭa</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fostia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. hostio, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n21011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an animal sacrificed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a victim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi> (cf.: victima). </sense><sense id="n21011.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Trebatius doceat, hostiarum genera esse duo, unum in quo voluntas dei per exta disquiritur, alterum, in quo sola anima deo sacratur, unde etiam haruspices animales has hostias vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ex institutis pontificum et haruspicum non mutandum est, quibus hostiis immolandum cuique deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea prodigia partim majoribus hostiis partim lactentibus procurarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majoribus hostiis rem divinam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri immolare hostiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiis propitiare Venerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">v. 27: Pseudole, arcesse hostias, Victimas, lanios, ut ego huic sacrificem summo Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostias immolare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostias ad sacrificium praebere ... hostias redimere (used interchangeably with victimae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae omnibus locis immolabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Mario per hostias dis supplicanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum cum sanguine sacro Hostia caelestes pacificasset heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scelus perficiendum caesis hostiis (shortly before: nocturna sacrificia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactata hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sumptuosa blandior hostia Mollivit aversos Penates Farre pio et saliente mica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadraginta hostiis sacrificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiis piare prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si primis hostiis litatum non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruminalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl></cit>: maximam hostiam ovilli pecoris appellabant, non ab amplitudine corporis sed ab animo placidiore, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galli) humanis hostiis aras ac templa funestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli pro victimis homines immolant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16, 2</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humanis hostiis litare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>.—Collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 334</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21011.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, Hostia, <hi rend="ital">a group of stars belonging to the constellation Centaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:37" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hostiatus: <entryFree id="n21012" type="hapax" key="hosti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hostia</etym>, <sense id="n21012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with victims</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidatas venire hostiatasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hosticapas: <entryFree id="n21013" type="gloss" key="hosticapas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hosticapas</orth>, <itype>hostium captor</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll. [hostis-capio; the final <sense id="n21013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">s</hi> is archaic, as in PARICIDAS for parricida].</sense></entryFree>
hosticus: <entryFree id="n21014" type="main" key="hosti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hostis</etym>. <sense id="n21014.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:893" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 893</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incursiones, Col. praef. § 19: tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the enemy's territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in hostico incuriose posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptae ex hostico messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transire in hosticum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Constant. 13</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">enmity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosticum spirare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mag. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21014.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosticum hoc mihi domiciliumst, Athenis domus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hostifer: <entryFree id="n21015" type="hapax" key="hosti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hostis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n21015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 420</bibl></cit> dub. <pb n="868" /> <cb n="HOST" /></sense></entryFree>
hostifice: <entryFree id="n21016" type="main" key="hosti^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hostificus <sense id="n21016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hostificus: <entryFree id="n21017" type="main" key="hosti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hostis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n21017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deals in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> (anteclass.): o dirum hostificumque diem! Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 24</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 80 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 23, 60</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hostĭ-fĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a hostile manner</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 11</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. v. 82 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
hostilina: <entryFree id="n21018" type="main" key="Hosti^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hostĭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hostio = aequo</etym>, <sense id="n21018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that promotes the growth of corn in equal ears</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 8.</sense></entryFree>
hostilis: <entryFree id="n21019" type="main" key="hosti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hostis</etym>. <sense id="n21019.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21019.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amator simili'st oppidi hostilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 16, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condictiones pactionesque (with bellicae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 20: nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hostīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hostile country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the enemy's land</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prior Parthus apud Gaium in nostra ripa, posterior hic apud regem in hostili (sc. solo) epulatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:101" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21019.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in divining: <cit><quote lang="la">hostilis pars (opp. pars familiaris),</quote> <trans><tr>the part of the entrails that related to the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 622</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21019.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is usual with an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominis hostilem in modum seditiosi imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostilem in modum vexare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc hostili odio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ab se hostile timeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem, fugam aliaque hostilia portendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati retulerunt, omnia hostilia
