esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa hostilia audere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invicem coeptare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apibus inimica est nebula: aranei quoque vel maxime hostiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hostī-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ille fecit hostiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 372</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hostilitas: <entryFree id="n21020" type="main" key="hosti_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hostilis</etym>, <sense id="n21020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hostiliter: <entryFree id="n21021" type="main" key="hosti_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hostilis <sense id="n21021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hostilius: <entryFree id="n21022" type="main" key="Hosti_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hostīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n21022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n21022.1" n="1" level="3"> Hostus Hostilius, <hi rend="ital">who fought victoriously against the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21022.2" n="2" level="3"> His grandson, Tullus Hostilius, <hi rend="ital">the third king of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21022.3" n="3" level="3"> L. Hostilius Tubulus, <hi rend="ital">prœtor in</hi> A. U. C. 611, <hi rend="ital">a rude person</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n21022.4" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hostīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Hostilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hostilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curia,</quote> <trans><tr>built by king Tullus Hostilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> Müll.: Hostiliis Laribus immolabant, quod ab his hostes arceri putabant (perhaps named after Hostus Hostilius), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hostimentum: <entryFree id="n21023" type="main" key="hosti_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. hostio</etym>, <sense id="n21023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requital</hi>: hostimentum beneficii pensatio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostimentum est aequamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit> (ante-class.): audi atque auditis hostimentum adjungito, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 154 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">par pari datum hostimentum'st, opera pro pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: beneficiis hostimentum peperisti grave, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 315, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hostio: <entryFree id="n21024" type="main" key="hostio1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n21024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return like for like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recompense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">requite</hi>: hostire (ab antiquis) ponebatur pro aequare. Fest. s. v. status dies, p. 314 Müll.; ib. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 (ante-class.): nisi coërceo Protervitatem atque hostio ferociam, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 121, 16</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 346 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quin promitto hostire contra, ut merueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21025" type="main" key="hostio2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n21025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>: hostia dicta est ab eo, quod est hostire ferire, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll. (ante-class.): quae mea comminus machaera atque hasta<cb n="HOST" />  hostibit e manu, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 Müll. (Trag. v. 212 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
hostis: <entryFree id="n21026" type="main" key="hostis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostis</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fos-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root ghas-, to eat, consume, destroy; Germ. Gast; cf. also hasta</etym>, <sense id="n21026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stranger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreigner;</hi> afterwards transf., <hi rend="ital">an enemy</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarius, inimicus, perduellis): equidem etiam illud animadverto, quod qui proprio nomine perduellis esset, is hostis vocaretur, lenitate verbi rei tristitiam mitigatam. Hostis enim apud majores nostros is dicebatur, quem nunc peregrinum dicimus ... quamquam id nomen durius effecit jam vetustas: a peregrino enim recessit et proprie in eo qui arma contra ferret remansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 3</bibl> Müll.: hostis apud antiquos peregrinus dicebatur, et qui nunc hostis perduellio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n21026.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An enemy</hi> in arms or of one's country (opp. inimicus, a private enemy, or one who is inimically disposed). </sense><sense id="n21026.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pompeius) saepius cum hoste conflixit quam quisquam cum inimico concertavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes nos statuit ille quidem non inimicos sed hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inimicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit> (v. also the foll.): <cit><quote lang="la">debent oratori sic esse adversariorum nota consilia, ut hostium imperatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes nefarios prostravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bellum) compellere intra hostium moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita ex hostium telis servata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adventus hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam (probitatem) vel in eis quos numquam vidimus, vel, quod majus est, in hoste etiam diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem rapinis prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando hostis alienigena terrae Italiae bellum intulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servit Hispanae vetus hostis orae Cantaber sera domitus catena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra marique victus hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicis quoque et hostibus ea indigna videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicus, hostis esset, tanta contumelia accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:24:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 24, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi inimicus atque hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum omnium communis hostis praedoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam dis hominibusque hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Pompeius auctor et dux mei reditus, illius (Clodii) hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer Bupalo hostis (Hipponax),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas est et ab hoste doceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora piis erroremque hostibus illum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 513</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:494" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 6, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (aquam) hostis hosti commodat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis est uxor, invita quae ad virum nuptum datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nupta meretrici hostis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quo die captam hostem vidisset, eodem matrimonio junctam acciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum certa videbitur hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille uxorem, tu hostem luges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21026.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals or things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">qualem ministrum fulminis alitem ... in ovilia Demisit hostem vividus impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:359" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhinoceros genitus hostis elephanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 20, 29, § 71</bibl></cit>.—Of a chessman: <cit><quote lang="la">unus cum gemino calculus hoste perit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, pereat vitreo miles ab hoste tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ipsa natura non parens sed noverca fuerit, si facultatem dicendi sociam scelerum, adversam innocentiae, hostem veritatis invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vero vitiosissima, quae jam humanitas vocatur, studiorum perniciosissima hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21026.4" n="2" level="3"> Of an adversary in a suit, in a parody of the law of the Twelve Tables: <cit><quote lang="la">si status condictus cum hoste intercedit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hostius: <entryFree id="n21027" type="main" key="Hosti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hostĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n21027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4, p. 228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, p. 228</bibl> Gerl. Min. (Dietsch, 4, 27; Hostilius); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hostorium: <entryFree id="n21028" type="gloss" key="hosto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. hostio</etym>, <sense id="n21028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument used in levelling a measure of corn</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a strickle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 688</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
hostus: <entryFree id="n21029" type="main" key="hostus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hostus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. a rustic term for haustus</etym>, <sense id="n21029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the yield of an olive-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21030" type="main" key="Hostus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hostus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prœnomen</hi>, as Hostus Hostilius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hostus Lucretius Tricipitinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30 al.</bibl></cit> <cb n="HUC" /></sense></entryFree>
huc: <entryFree id="n21031" type="main" key="huc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">huc</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">hoc</orth>, <itype>like illoc, istoc</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 27</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 48</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:10:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4394</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4814</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad Verg. A. l. l.), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n21031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to this place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hither</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">deu=ro</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n21031.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: imus huc, illuc hinc: cum illuc ventum est, ire illinc lubet, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 258 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">huc illinc venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam huc adveniet miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater huc me misit ad vos oratum meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin huc ad vos venire propero?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc profecti huc revertuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc raro in urbem commeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te huc foras seduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc est intro latus lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc huc convenite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc mecum, Epidauria proles, huc, alti gaudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus erat castrorum editus, huc magno cursu contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi arma esse sciam, huc veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic inde huc omnes currunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:308" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 308</bibl></cit>.—Pregn., with verbs expressing state or action after motion (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">huc ades, o formose puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc ager ille malus dulcesque a fontibus undae ad plenum calcentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:54" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed huc qua gratia te arcessi jussi, ausculta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc propius me vos ordine adite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier ex Andro commigravit huc viciniae,</quote> <trans><tr>into this neighborhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit> Fleck., Umpfenbach (dub.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 499</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> II. p. 187</bibl>; Hand, Turs. III. p. 107; cf. II. B. infra).—</sense><sense id="n21031.3" n="C" level="2"> Huc illuc, huc atque illuc, huc et illuc, etc.; also: huc et illo and huc et huc, <hi rend="ital">hither and thither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cursem huc illuc via deterrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut salientes huc illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum huc illuc signa vertunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum huc atque illuc signa transferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc atque illuc intuentem vagari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum huc, tum illuc volant alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres huc et illuc passim vagantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc illucque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 22, § 83</bibl></cit> (Jan., ex illo): <cit><quote lang="la">huc illucve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista sidera huc et illo diducet velocitas sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ora vertat huc et huc euntium Liberrima indignatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.4" n="D" level="2"> Huc usque, or in one word, hucusque, <hi rend="ital">hitherto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus far</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hucusque Sesostris exercitum duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in non-local relations, <hi rend="ital">hither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to these</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to this point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec multo ante meditere, huc te pares, haec cogites, ad haec te exerceas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedat huc suavitas quaedam oportet sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>; so freq., huc accedit, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. accedo: Massilienses naves longas expediunt numero XVII. Multa huc minora navigia addunt,</quote> <trans><tr>add to these</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 56, 1</bibl></cit>; so freq., adde huc; <cit><quote lang="la">v. addo: legiones effecerat civium Romanorum IX., etc ... Huc Dardanos, etc., adjecerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc natas adice septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc pertinet nobile apud Graecos volumen Heraclidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 175</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, like eo, followed by <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc unius mulieris libidinem esse prolapsum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem huc deduxi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc flexit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem Romanam huc satietate gloriae provectam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc cecidisse Germanici exercitus gloriam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.6" n="B" level="2"> So, like eo, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc arrogantiae venerat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc deductum necessitatis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit> ext. 6; cf. above, I. B.—</sense><sense id="n21031.7" n="C" level="2"> Huc et illuc: <cit><quote lang="la">versare suam naturam et regere ad tempus atque huc et illuc torquere ac flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc et illuc rapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verses te huc atque illuc necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in dubio est animus, paulo momento huc vel illuc impellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.8" n="D" level="2"> Huc usque or hucusque, <hi rend="ital">to such an extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pitch</hi> (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 530 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirum esset profecto, hucusque profectam credulitatem antiquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum duxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatio hucusque procedit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21031.9" n="E" level="2"> With the demonstr. <hi rend="ital">ce</hi>, and the interrog <pb n="869" /> <cb n="HUMA" /> part. <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, hucine? <hi rend="ital">hitherto? to this? so far?</hi> hucine tandem omnia reciderunt, ut civis Romanus virgis caederetur? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hucine. Micipsa pater, beneficia tua evasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hucine rerum Venimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21031.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To this end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for this purpose</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">rubrum quoque emplastrum, quod Ephesium vocatur, huc aptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hucine: <entryFree id="n21032" type="main" key="huci^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hucĭnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. huc, II. E.</entryFree>
hucusque: <entryFree id="n21033" type="main" key="hucusque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hucusque</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. huc, I. D. and II. D.</entryFree>
hui: <entryFree id="n21034" type="main" key="hui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hui</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of astonishment or admiration, <sense id="n21034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hah! ho! oh!</hi> hui, homunculi quanti estis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui, dixti pulchre!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta? hui, percara est!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui, tam cito? ridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Prorsum nihil intelligo. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Hui, tardus est! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui, quantam fenestram ad nequitiam patefeceris!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbam sermones: Hui! fratrem reliquit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hui quam diu de nugis!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hujuscemodi: <entryFree id="n21035" type="main" key="hu_jusce^mo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūjuscĕmŏdi</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūjusmŏdi</orth>, v. under modus.</entryFree>
hulcus: <entryFree id="n21036" type="main" key="hulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hulcus</orth>, v. ulcus.</entryFree>
humanatus: <entryFree id="n21037" type="main" key="hu_ma_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. humano.</entryFree>
humane: <entryFree id="n21038" type="main" key="hu_ma_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. humanus <sense id="n21038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
humanitas: <entryFree id="n21039" type="main" key="hu_ma_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>humanus</etym>, <sense id="n21039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">human nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humanity</hi>, in a good sense; <hi rend="ital">the qualities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feelings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and inclinations of mankind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21039.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (for the most part only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">magna est vis humanitatis, multum valet communio sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturas hominum vimque omnem humanitatis penitus perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis humanitatis jus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">communis humanitatis causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peterem errato veniam ex humanitate communi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis prima species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at natura certe dedit, ut humanitatis non parum haberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatem tuam amoremque in tuos reditus celeritas declarabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potuisse (te) non commoveri (viri amicissimi morte) nec fuisse id humanitatis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac, id quod est humanitatis tuae, ne quid aliud cures hoc tempore, nisi ut quam commodissime convalescas,</quote> <trans><tr>which you owe to yourself as a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduitate molestiarum sensum omnem humanitatis ex animis amittimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ad ista obduruimus et humanitatem omnem exuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ex ejus animo exstirpatam humanitatem arbitramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age vero, quid esse potest in otio aut jucundius aut magis proprium humanitatis quam sermo facetus ac nulla in re rudis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines quidem pereunt: ipsa humanitas, ad quam homo effingitur, permanet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21039.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., i. q. humanum genus, <hi rend="ital">the human race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mankind</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-class.): ista in figura hominis feritas a communi tamquam humanitatis corpore segreganda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatem hoc loco dicimus omne hominum genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem omnem, quo humanitas regitur, sustulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trism. p. 288</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n21039.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21039.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Humane</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle conduct</hi> towards others, <hi rend="ital">humanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philanthropy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politeness</hi> (syn.: comitas, facilitas, mansuetudo, clementia, opp. severitas; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. and class.): quemquamne existimas Catone proavo tuo commodiorem, communiorem, moderatiorem fuisse ad omnem rationem humanitatis? ... Sed si illius comitatem et facilitatem tuae gravitati severitatique asperseris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tua facilitate et humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficillimam illam societatem gravitatis cum humanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut summa severitas summa cum humanitate jungatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad humanitatem atque mansuetudinem revocavit animos hominum, studiis bellandi jam immanes ac feros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 33, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 42</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: omnia plena clementiae, mansuetudinis, humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: pro sua clementia atque <cb n="HUMA" /> humanitate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:21:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantaque poena (eos) afficiamus, quantam aequitas humanitasque patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis humanitas suavissimique mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris summa erga nos humanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem erga me, humanitatem suavitatemque desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitas vetat superbum esse adversus socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis praecipua pars est, honestissimum quemque complecti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vero vitiosissima, quae jam humanitas vocatur, invicem qualiacumque laudandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21039.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mental cultivation befitting a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberal education</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good breeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance of manners</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refinement</hi> (cf. on this signif. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 16</bibl>; syn.: doctrina, litterae, eruditio; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): homo non communium litterarum et politioris humanitatis expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse politum propriis humanitatis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitate politiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni recto studio atque humanitate versari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 60, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ulla bona arte, sine humanitate, sine ingenio, sine litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinae studium atque humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">propter humanitatem atque doctrinam Anco regi familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni genere sermonis, in omni parte humanitatis dixerim oratorem perfectum esse debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 35</bibl> (Ellendt ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">orator inops quidam humanitatis atque inurbanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae multum ab humanitate discrepant, ut si quis in foro cantet,</quote> <trans><tr>good manners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem opinor in hac ironia dissimulantiaque longe lepore et humanitate omnibus praestisse,</quote> <trans><tr>polished language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(epistulae) humanitatis sparsae sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus litteras aut humanitatem adamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris, et humanitate alicujus delectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humaniter: <entryFree id="n21040" type="main" key="hu_ma_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. humanus <sense id="n21040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
humanitus: <entryFree id="n21041" type="main" key="hu_ma_ni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>humanus, like divinitus from divinus</etym>, <sense id="n21041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">humanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of men.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21041.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare but class.): ferre humana humanitus, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 20</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 290 Rib.); so, quicquam facere, Turp. ib. (Com. Fragm. v. 165 Rib.): si quid me (i. e. mihi) fuerit humanitus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=161" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 161</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 128 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid mihi humanitus accidisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>should I die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ei humanitus attigisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursi coëunt humanitus strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21041.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., for the usual humane and humaniter, <hi rend="ital">humanely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humano: <entryFree id="n21042" type="main" key="hu_ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmāno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> <etym>humanus</etym>, <sense id="n21042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make human;</hi> only used in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of the incarnation of Christ: promittentes Deum propter salutem credentium visualiter humanandum, Cassiod. in Psa. praef.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verbum humanatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hist. Eccles. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humanus: <entryFree id="n21043" type="main" key="hu_ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānus</orth> (old form: HEMONA humana et HEMONEM hominem dicebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=100" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 100</bibl> Müll.; cf. homo <sense id="n21043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>homo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">human.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21043.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquem humana specie et figura, qui tantum immanitate bestias vicerit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <trans><tr>a human head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl>: succidiae, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>: Cyclopis venter ... Carnibus humanis distentus, <hi rend="ital">human flesh</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 327 Vahl,): <cit><quote lang="la">humana qui dape pavit equas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenas obsidione et fame ad humanos cibos compulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <trans><tr>human sacrifices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10</bibl></cit> 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans><tr>human milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec distare humana carne suillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnibus humanis vesci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas generis humani,</quote> <trans><tr>of the human race</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: eos (deos) non curare opinor quid agat humanum genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:50:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 50, 104</bibl> (Trag. v. 354 Vahl.); v. genus: ubi remissa humana vita corpus requiescat malis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 416 ib.); cf.: humanae vitae varia reputantes mala, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl>; in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cb n="HUMA" /> ergo hercules vita humanior sine sale non quit degere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium divinarum humanarumque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. divinus: amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanissima voluptas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which men daily use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>human excrements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra modum humanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanum facinus factumst,</quote> <trans><tr>customary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam dixerit, in eo qui obdormivit, rem eum humanam et naturalem passum, Mos. et Rom. Coll. 12, 7, 7: major imago humana,</quote> <trans><tr>of superhuman size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:222" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 222</bibl></cit>: humanum sacrificium dicebant, quod mortui causa fiebat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>committed against men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: si quid mihi humanum contigerit, <hi rend="ital">if any thing should happen to me</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">if I should die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 26</bibl> (for which, humanitus, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">persuasit nox, amor, vinum, adulescentia: Humanum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: metum virgarum navarchus pretio redemit: humanum est; <cit><quote lang="la">alius, ne condemnaretur, pecuniam dedit: usitatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humano quodam modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: res humani juris, <hi rend="ital">property</hi> (opp. res divini juris, <hi rend="ital">things sacred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">religious</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 97: ne vinum ... esse sacrum incipiat et ex usibus eripiatur humanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> adv. Gent. 7, 31</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21043.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:837" default="NO" valid="yes">837</bibl>: natura humanis omnia sunt paria, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21043.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is human</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortal</hi>, etc.: ignem magnum hic faciam. <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Quine ut humanum exuras tibi? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle humanust ergo: nam volturio plus humani credost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam in vobis non dico civilis sed humani esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher et humano major trabeaque decorus Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 503</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 5</bibl>, homo is the true reading): <cit><quote lang="la">homo sum: humani nihil a me alienum puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satyris praeter effigiem nihil humani, Mela, 1, 8, 10: si in Pompeio quid humani evenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 5, 16</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n21043.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmā-na</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">human affairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the concerns of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">events of life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia humana, quaecumque accidere possunt, tolerabilia ducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">despicientem omnia humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">haec caelestia semper spectato, illa humana contemnito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quicquam humanorum certi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos esse et non neglegere humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 56, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">respiratio humanior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>freer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21043.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21043.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Humane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philanthropic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">comis, urbanus): te esse humano ingenio existumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrum minorem Persarum regem et ceteris in rebus communem erga Lysandrum atque humanum fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo facillimus atque humanissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">humani ingeni Mansuetique animi officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: quod ipse moderatissimi atque humanissimi fuit sensus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis (praeceptum) humanissimum utilissimumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 44</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n21043.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of good education</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-informed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>: gentem quidem nullam video neque tam humanam atque doctam neque tam immanem atque barbaram, quae non significari futura posse censeat, Civ. Div. 1, 1, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo doctissimus atque humanissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines periti et humani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 28</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">70: haec ego non possum dicere non esse hominis quamvis et belli et humani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: Praxiteles nemini est paulum modo humaniori ignotus, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 16, 3</bibl> (eruditiori doctiorique, Gell.; <cit><quote lang="la">see the entire chap.): humanissimussermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmānĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n21043.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Humanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeably to human nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner becoming humanity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21043.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form humane: <cit><quote lang="la">vix humane patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: intervalla vides humane commoda, i. e. <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charmingly commodious</hi>,<pb n="870" /> <cb n="HUMI" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos toleranter atque humane ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21043.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form humaniter: <cit><quote lang="la">docebo profecto, quid sit humaniter vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliter acciderit, humaniter feremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21043.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui forte, cum se in luctu esse vellent, aliquid fecerunt humanius, aut si hilarius locuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21043.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">humanely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">politely</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n21043.13" n="(a)" level="5"> Form humane: Hirtium aliquid ad te <foreign lang="greek">sumpaqw=s</foreign> de me scripsisse facile patior: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit enim humane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21043.14" n="(b)" level="5"> Form humaniter: invitus litteras tuas scinderem: ita sunt humaniter scriptae, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit humaniter Licinius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21043.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod se sua voluntate erga Caesarem humanissime diligentissimeque locutus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam humanissime scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 8</bibl>; cf. Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem se itineris humanissime promisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humatio: <entryFree id="n21044" type="main" key="hu^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>humo</etym>, <sense id="n21044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burying</hi> (very rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultura, funus, exsequiae): de humatione et sepultura dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus qui recipiat humationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:22:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 24, 22, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humator: <entryFree id="n21045" type="hapax" key="hu^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who buries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 799</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humectatio: <entryFree id="n21046" type="main" key="hu_mecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmectātĭo</orth>, v. umectatio.</entryFree>
humecto: <entryFree id="n21047" type="main" key="hu_mecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmecto</orth>, v. umecto.</entryFree>
humectus: <entryFree id="n21048" type="main" key="hu_mectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmectus</orth>, v. umectus.</entryFree>
humefacio: <entryFree id="n21049" type="main" key="hu_me^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmĕfăcĭo</orth>, v. umefacio.</entryFree>
humeo: <entryFree id="n21050" type="main" key="hu_me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmĕo</orth>, v. umeo.</entryFree>
humerale: <entryFree id="n21051" type="main" key="hu^me^ra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĕrāle</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĕrus</orth>, etc., v. umerale, umerus, etc.</entryFree>
humesco: <entryFree id="n21052" type="main" key="hu_mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmesco</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hūmĭdus</orth>, etc., v. umesco, umidus, etc.</entryFree>
humi: <entryFree id="n21053" type="main" key="hu^mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmi</orth>, v. humus, III.</entryFree>
humifer: <entryFree id="n21054" type="main" key="hu_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmĭfer</orth>, etc., v. umifer, etc.</entryFree>
humiliatio: <entryFree id="n21055" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>humilio</etym>, <sense id="n21055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an humbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humiliation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Herm. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Patient. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Mic. 6, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
humilifico: <entryFree id="n21056" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>humilis - facio</etym>, <sense id="n21056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to humble</hi> (post - class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
humilio: <entryFree id="n21057" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>humilis</etym>, <sense id="n21057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to abase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus, quod humiliatur in passionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra nos hic humiliamus, ut ibi possimus esse majores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanus vultu humiliatus atque dejectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad humiliandum celsitudinem potestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
humilis: <entryFree id="n21058" type="main" key="hu^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>humus; like <foreign lang="greek">xamalo/s</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">xamai/</foreign>, on the ground, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n21058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n21058.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores et vites et ea quae sunt humiliora neque se tollere a terra altius possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim humilem parvamque fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:8:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 8, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilior munitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) humiliores quam quibus in nostro mari uti consuevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiles habitare casas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:426" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgas humilis mordere salicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Forentum,</quote> <trans><tr>low</tr>, <tr>situated in the plain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Myconos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humillimo solo aqua diutissime immorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avi similis, quae circum litora, circum Piscosos scopulos humilis volat aequora juxta,</quote> <trans><tr>flies low</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 255</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decisis humilis pennis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest ex deformi humilique corpusculo exire formosus animus ac magnus,</quote> <trans><tr>small</tr>, <tr>diminutive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi atque humili corpore homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiles Cleonae,</quote> <trans><tr>little</tr>, <tr>petty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 417</bibl></cit> (in Ptolem. <foreign lang="greek">po/lis ou) mega/lh</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:424" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse humili designat moenia fossa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slight</tr>, <tr>shallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 157</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n21058.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21058.3" n="A" level="2"> As respects rank, birth, fortune, worth, consideration, etc., <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex, summissus, demissus, abjectus): ut si parentibus nati sint humilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiles nati (shortly after: trivio conceptus et educatus stercore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: humiles et <cb n="HUMI" /> obscuri homines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humillimus homo de plebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis in plebe et ideo ignobilis puerpera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne latos fines parare studeant potentioresque humiliores possessionibus expellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiliores, opp. opulentiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos Suevi vectigales sibi fecerunt ac multo humiliores infirmioresque redegerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: homines humiles, opp. amplissimi viri, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8</bibl>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque humilis est, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junge tuis humiles, ambitiose, manus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the servants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas ignobilis atque humilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilem sane relinquunt et minime generosum, ut ita dicam, ortum amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Viridomarus, quem Caesar ex humili loco ad summam dignitatem perduxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cogitationes suas abjecerunt in rem tam humilem atque contemptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>;
