cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil abjectum, nihil humile cogitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nulla aut humili aliqua arte praediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiles et sordidae curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei pictor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 120</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Jan. floridissimus): humilis atque obsoletus vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agna,</quote> <trans><tr>poor</tr>, <tr>humble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:287" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:171" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 171</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is humble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a low station</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex humili potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales ex humili magna ad vestigia rerum extollit Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: Humiles laborant ubi potentes dissident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21058.4" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi> language: iambus frequentissimus est in iis, quae demisso atque humili sermone dicuntur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:196" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 229</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque humilem et abjectam orationem nec nimis altam et exaggeratam probat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:192" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilia et vulgaria verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis sublimia humilibus misceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae humilia circa res magnas, apta circa minores videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humile et quotidianum sermonis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">of the author himself: Macer ... humilis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>commonplace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil parvum aut humili modo, Nil mortale loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21058.5" n="B" level="2"> Of mind or character, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui umquam apparitor tam humilis? tam abjectus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ille tum humilis, ut demissus erat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humillimus assentator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque nos simus tam humiles, ut quae laudamus inutilia credamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privata deduci superbo Non humilis mulier triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succumbere doloribus eosque humili animo imbecilloque ferre miserum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prece et obsecratione humili ac supplici utemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fracto animo, atque humili aliquem supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humillimae preces, Suet. Vit. Luc.: pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 331</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:394" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 394</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deeply.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21058.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in loco clivoso humilius rami arborum servandisunt, in plano altius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem facta claritate vel obscuritate facientium vel tolluntur altissime vel humillime deprimuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>very deeply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21058.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to II. B.), <hi rend="ital">basely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abjectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humbly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non est ausus elate et ample loqui, cum humiliter demisseque sentiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut servit humiliter, aut superbe dominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacter territas, humiliter placas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animose paupertatem ferre, humiliter infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
humilitas: <entryFree id="n21059" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>humilis</etym>, <sense id="n21059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lowness</hi> (acc. to humilis, I.). </sense><sense id="n21059.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves omnes actuarias imperat fieri, quam ad rem humilitas multum adjuvat (shortly before: naves paulo facit humiliores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum animalium ea est humilitas, ut cibum terrestrem rostris facile contingant,</quote> <trans><tr>low stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2</bibl></cit> 47, 122: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera multum inter se aut altitudine aut humilitate distantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta humilitate luna feratur, terram paene contingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21059.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21059.3" n="A" level="2"> Of rank, birth, or influence, <hi rend="ital">lowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificance</hi>:<cb n="HUMU" />  malorum turba quaedam, paupertas, ignobilitas, humilitas, solitudo, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter humilitatem et obscuritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitatem cum dignitate contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus despicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere humilitatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex humilitate sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infima natalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis ac nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliterata quoque scrutabimur, nec deterrebit quarundam rerum humilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21059.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Littleness of mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abjectness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet levitatem laetitia gestiens, humilitatem metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dejecto (capite) humilitas et supino arrogantia ostenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. arrogantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe virtus et magnificentia plus proficit ad misericordiam commovendam quam humilitas et obsecratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:56:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 56, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summittere se in humilitatem causam dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21059.5" n="2" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., in a good sense, opp. to pride, <hi rend="ital">lowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sever. Vit. S. Mart. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
humiliter: <entryFree id="n21060" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭter</orth>, v. humilis <sense id="n21060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
humilito: <entryFree id="n21061" type="main" key="hu^mi^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmĭlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>humilis</etym>, <sense id="n21061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to humiliate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>: maternum genus, Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl> (p. 364 Bait.).</sense></entryFree>
humo: <entryFree id="n21062" type="main" key="hu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>humus</etym>, <sense id="n21062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bury.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21062.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sepelio, tumulo): in terram cadentibus corporibus iisque humo tectis, e quo dictum est humari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignotum quendam projectum mortuum vidisset eumque humavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesorum reliquias uno tumulo humaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: humatus et conditus est, id. Vit. Hor.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl> (4, 15), 29: sepulcrum ubi mortuus sepultus aut humatus sit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus humandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 161</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n21062.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qa/ptein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to pay the last dues</hi> to a body, <hi rend="ital">to perform the funeral rites</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militari honestoque funere humaverunt ossaque ejus in Cappadociam deportanda curarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
humor: <entryFree id="n21063" type="main" key="hu_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmor</orth>, v. umor.</entryFree>
humorosus: <entryFree id="n21064" type="main" key="hu_mo_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hūmōrōsus</orth>, v. umorosus.</entryFree>
humus: <entryFree id="n21065" type="main" key="hu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hŭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (archaic form of the <sense id="n21065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> humu, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 6</bibl> and 48, 26), <gen>f.</gen> (archaic <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> humum humidum pedibus fodit, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 719</bibl> P.: humidum humum, Gracch. ib.) [from the prim. form XAM, whence <foreign lang="greek">xămai/, xămo/qen, xăma^lo/s</foreign>, Lat. humilis; kindr. with Sanscr. Xám, earth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xqw/n</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the soil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21065.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf.: terra, solum, tellus): humus erat immunda, lutulenta vino, coronis languidulis et spinis coöperta piscium, Cic. Fragm. Or. pro Gall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl> (ap. Orell. IV. 2, p. 454); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia constrata telis, armis, cadaveribus et inter ea humus infecta sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subacta atque pura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: cubitis pinsibant humum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 23</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 435 Vahl.); cf.: procubuit moriens et humum semel ore momordit. <hi rend="ital">bit the ground and died</hi> (cf. the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">o)da\c e(lei=n gai=an</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 418</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcibus atram Tundit humum exspirans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 731</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede candido In morem Salium ter quatient humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acestes aequaevum ab humo attollit amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse feraces Figat humo plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">semina spargere humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:735" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 735</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec se movit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectoque in humum vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:607" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter humum volitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi atque ipsius stirpis laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis cibus erat caro ferina atque humi pabulum uti pecoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, quos humus injecta contegeret (shortly afterwards, gleba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (genera arborum) humi arido atque arenoso gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, as a fig. for what is low, mean, common: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones repentes per humum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 251</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, dum vitat humum, nubes et inania captet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad humum maerore gravi deducit et angit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 110</bibl></cit>; v. also <pb n="871" /> <cb n="HYAL" /> under <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">affigit humo divinae particulam aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21065.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., like solum, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Punica nec Teucris pressa fuisset humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:490" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 5, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21065.3" n="III" level="1"> Adverbial form <orth extent="full" lang="la">humi</orth>, like <foreign lang="greek">xamai/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">on the ground</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit humi tutus nimium timidusque procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque humi defixa tua mens erit?</quote> <trans><tr>fixed on the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus circiter duodecim pedes humi depressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot humi morientia corpora fundis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere humi dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc stravit humi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:255" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremens procumbit humi bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvitur ille excussus humi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 640</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">projectum humi jugulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratus humi palmes viduas desiderat ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hunni: <entryFree id="n21066" type="main" key="Hunni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hunni</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Chunni</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chūni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Huns</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 1, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 270</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3 praef.</bibl> 1. Form Chuni, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 1, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chū-nus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 238</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21066.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hunniscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Huns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hunnish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyacinthaeus: <entryFree id="n21067" type="greek" key="hy^a^cinthaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyăcinthaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(aki/nqaios</foreign>, <sense id="n21067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hyacinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hyacinthine</hi> (post-class. for hyacinthinus): ordo, <hi rend="ital">a row of hyacinths</hi>, Ven. Carm. 8, 8, 20; 6, 270.</sense></entryFree>
hyacinthia: <entryFree id="n21068" type="main" key="Hy^a^cinthi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyăcinthĭa</orth>, v. Hyacinthus, I. B.</entryFree>
hyacinthinus: <entryFree id="n21069" type="greek" key="hy^a^cinthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyăcinthĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(aki/nqinos</foreign>, <sense id="n21069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hyacinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hyacinthine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <trans><tr>the hyacinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hyacinth-colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:32" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hyacinthizontes: <entryFree id="n21070" type="greek" key="hy^a^cinthi_zontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyăcinthīzontes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(akinqizontes</foreign>, <sense id="n21070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hyacinth-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">berylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
hyacinthus: <entryFree id="n21071" type="main" key="Hy^a^cinthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyăcinthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ua/kinqos</foreign>, <sense id="n21071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beautiful Spartan youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and accidentally killed by a blow of his quoit; from his blood sprang the flower of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marked with the exclamation</hi> AI, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:162 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 162 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 272" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 3, 63</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: sed gladiator erat; <cit><quote lang="la">facit hoc illos Hyacinthos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as beautiful as Hyacinthus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21071.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyăcinthĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival in honor of Hyacinthus</hi>, in Sparta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 219</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21071.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hyăcinthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the hyacinth</hi>, not, however, our hyacinth, but either the <hi rend="ital">blue iris</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleur-delis</hi>, Iris Germanica, Linn.; the <hi rend="ital">corn-flag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gladiolus</hi>, Gladiolus communis, Linn.; or the <hi rend="ital">rocket larkspur</hi>, Delphinium Ajacis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 69</bibl>; Col. poët. 10,100.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21071.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of a hyacinth</hi> (perh. our <hi rend="ital">sapphire</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">dark-colored amethyst</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:125 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 41, § 125 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2510</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyades: <entryFree id="n21072" type="main" key="Hy^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ua/des</foreign> (the rainers), <sense id="n21072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hyades</hi>, a group of seven stars in the head of Taurus (called in pure Lat. suculae; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 3. sucula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:100" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 7, 28, § 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 106</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">They were fabled as daughters of Atlas and sisters of Hyas and of the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:165 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 165 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 595</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 14</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Hyad</hi>, collect., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyaena: <entryFree id="n21073" type="greek" key="hy^aena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/aina</foreign>, <sense id="n21073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hyena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 44, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 410</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21073.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seafish</hi>, a kind of <hi rend="ital">sole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyaenius: <entryFree id="n21074" type="main" key="hy^aeni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyaenĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hyaena</etym>, <sense id="n21074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from the hyena</hi>: gemma, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyale: <entryFree id="n21075" type="main" key="Hy^a^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ua/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n21075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyalinus: <entryFree id="n21076" type="greek" key="hy^a^li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyălĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(a/linos</foreign>. <sense id="n21076.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of glass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glass-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera, Fulg. Myth. praef.: pulvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 575</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21076.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Glass-green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 66 sq.</bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
hyaloides: <entryFree id="n21077" type="main" key="hy^a^lo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyălŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(aloeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grassgreen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
hyalus: <entryFree id="n21078" type="greek" key="hy^a^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/alos</foreign>, <sense id="n21078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21078.1" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="HYDR" /> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milesia vellera Carpebant hyali saturo fucata colore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with glass - green color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21078.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">glassgreen color</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 53; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 418</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyampolis: <entryFree id="n21079" type="main" key="Hy^ampo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyampŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ua/mpolis</foreign>, <sense id="n21079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Bœotia</hi>, its ruins near the village of Vogdhani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:345" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 345</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyantes: <entryFree id="n21080" type="main" key="Hy^antes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyantes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/uantes</foreign>, <sense id="n21080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hyantes</hi>, an old name of the <hi rend="ital">Bœotians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21080.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21080.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyan-tēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hyantes</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Bœotians</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Hyantean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bœotian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iolāus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aganippe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21080.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Camenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl></cit> in carm.: juvenis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Actœon</hi>, as grandson of Cadmus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyarotis: <entryFree id="n21081" type="main" key="Hy^a^ro_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyărōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uarw=tis</foreign> (or <foreign lang="greek">*(udraw/ths</foreign>), <sense id="n21081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Indus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ravi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyas: <entryFree id="n21082" type="main" key="Hy^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Hyān, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:179" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 179</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/uas</foreign>, <sense id="n21082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brother of the Hyades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 192" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:170" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 170</bibl>.—Hence, Sidus Hyantis, <hi rend="ital">the Hyades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:734" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 734</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n21083" type="main" key="Hy^as2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Hyades.</entryFree>
hybla: <entryFree id="n21084" type="main" key="Hybla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hybla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyblē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*(/ublh</foreign>, <sense id="n21084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Sicily abounding in flowers and bees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a city of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 13, 13, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:200" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:3" default="NO">10, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21084.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21084.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hy-blaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Hybla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hyblean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:42" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Sicilian Theocritus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21084.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyblenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Hybla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hybleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hybrida: <entryFree id="n21085" type="main" key="hybrida"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hybrida</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. hibrida.</entryFree>
hydaspes: <entryFree id="n21086" type="main" key="Hy^daspes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hydaspes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uda/sphs</foreign>. <sense id="n21086.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Indus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jeloum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12:8" default="NO">8, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:227 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 227 al.</bibl>—To denote <hi rend="ital">the East</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repressor Hydaspis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21086.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hydaspēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hydaspes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hydaspean;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">Indian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erythrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21086.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 747</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21086.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ethiopian slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hydatis: <entryFree id="n21087" type="greek" key="hy^da^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydătis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(dati/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watercolored gem</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyderos: <entryFree id="n21088" type="greek" key="hy^de^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydĕros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/deros</foreign> (i. q. <foreign lang="greek">u(/drwy</foreign>), <sense id="n21088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:97 sq" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 97 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hydra: <entryFree id="n21089" type="greek" key="Hy_dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳdra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/udra</foreign> [kindred with Sanscr. udri; Ang.-Sax. oter, otor; Engl. and Germ. Otter; cf. also the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/nudris</foreign>], <sense id="n21089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the water-serpent killed by Hercules near the Lernean Lake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Hydra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with seven heads; as fast as one of them was cut off two sprang up in its stead;</hi> it is also called Echidna: <cit><quote lang="la">Lernaea pestis, Hydra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 30" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:34" default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:151" default="NO">151</bibl>. As identified with Echidna, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Cerberus</hi>, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ne in istis duobus generibus hydra tibi sit et pellis, Hercules autem et alia opera majora, in illis rebus, quas praetermittis, relinquantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the easiest</tr>, <tr>the least important</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21089.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳdraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hydra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">germen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21089.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21089.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation of the Water-snake</hi>, also called Anguis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=214" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 214</bibl> (also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:40" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:39" default="NO">3, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21089.4" n="B" level="2"> Acc. to Verg., <hi rend="ital">a hydra with fifth heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that keeps watch at the gates of the Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 576</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hydragogia: <entryFree id="n21090" type="greek" key="hydra^go_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrăgōgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(dragwgi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n21090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an aqueduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">canal</hi>: venae (sunt) hydragogiae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 209, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Aur. <cb n="HYDR" /> Tard. 3, 8, 119.—</sense><sense id="n21091.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrage-gos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> chamaedaphne <hi rend="ital">and</hi> daphnites, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
