hydropisis: <entryFree id="n21120" type="greek" key="hydro_pi^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrōpĭsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(drw/pisis</foreign>, <sense id="n21120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; cf. the two foll. artt.</sense></entryFree>
hydropismus: <entryFree id="n21121" type="greek" key="hydro_pismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrōpismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(drwpismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:section=108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, § 108</bibl>; cf. the preced. and foll. artt.</sense></entryFree>
hydrops: <entryFree id="n21122" type="greek" key="hydrops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrops</orth>, <itype>ōpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/drwy</foreign>, <sense id="n21122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:96" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 96</bibl> sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrōpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the several kinds of dropsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hydroselinum: <entryFree id="n21123" type="greek" key="hydro^se^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrŏsĕlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(drose/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n21123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">marsh selinum</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hydruntum: <entryFree id="n21124" type="main" key="Hydruntum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hydruntum</orth>, v. 2. Hydrus.</entryFree>
hydrus: <entryFree id="n21125" type="greek" key="hydrus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hydrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/dros</foreign>, <sense id="n21125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a water-serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serpent</hi> (cf.: chelydrus, chersydrus, anguis, serpens). </sense><sense id="n21125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 22, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 458</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 753</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 804</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 98</bibl></cit>. In the hair of the Furies, of Medusa, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 447</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:195" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 800</bibl>; hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: nam si Vergilio puer et tolerabile desit Hospitium, caderent omnes a crinibus hydri, i. e. <hi rend="ital">all his poetic fire would have come to naught</hi> (referring to his description of the Furies, A. 7, 415 and 447), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21125.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The poison of a serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:322" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 322</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21125.4" n="B" level="2"> Hydros, i, <hi rend="ital">the constellation of the Waterserpent</hi>, called also Anguis and Hydra, <bibl default="NO"><author>German.</author> Arat. 429</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21126" type="main" key="Hydru_s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hydrūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(udrou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n21126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Calabria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under a mountain of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Otranto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, avius Hydrus, of the city and mountain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 375</bibl>.—The city is also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hydruntum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyemalis: <entryFree id="n21127" type="main" key="hy^e^ma_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyĕmālis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hyems</orth>, v. hiemalis, etc.</entryFree>
hyes: <entryFree id="n21128" type="main" key="Hyes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/uhs</foreign>, <sense id="n21128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the first three Dioscuri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53</bibl> (acc. to Lobeck's conject.).</sense></entryFree>
hyettus: <entryFree id="n21129" type="main" key="Hyettus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyettus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uhtto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of lake Copais</hi>, near the modern Strobiki, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hygea: <entryFree id="n21130" type="main" key="Hy^ge_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hygēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hygīa</orth> (Hygĭeia), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ugei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n21130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Æsculapius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and goddess of health</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:60:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 60, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1576</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
hyginus: <entryFree id="n21131" type="main" key="Hygi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hygīnus</orth> (Higinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:2" default="NO">1, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:8:1" default="NO">5, 8, 1</bibl> et saep.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surname of two Roman authors.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21131.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Julius Hyginus, <hi rend="ital">author of a collection of fables and of a treatise on astronomy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21131.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The author of a treatise</hi> De limitibus constituendis.</sense></entryFree>
hygra: <entryFree id="n21132" type="greek" key="hygra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hygra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(gra/</foreign> (liquid), <sense id="n21132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hygremplastrum: <entryFree id="n21133" type="greek" key="hygremplastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hygremplastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(gre/mplastron</foreign>, <sense id="n21133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wet plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 46, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hygrophobia: <entryFree id="n21134" type="greek" key="hygro^pho^bi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hygrŏphŏbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(grofobi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n21134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dread of liquids</hi>, as water, wine, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:9:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 9, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hylactor: <entryFree id="n21135" type="main" key="Hy^lactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hylactor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a hound of Actœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hylaeus: <entryFree id="n21136" type="main" key="Hy_laeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳlaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ulai=os</foreign> (v. Chandler, Gr. Accent. § 239). <sense id="n21136.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur who offered violence to Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 294</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21136.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hylaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Hylœus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille etiam (i. e. Milanion) Hylaei percussus vulnere rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21136.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hylas: <entryFree id="n21137" type="main" key="Hy^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hylas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ulas</foreign>, <sense id="n21137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beautiful youth of Œchalia</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">Argos</hi>), <hi rend="ital">companion of</hi> <cb n="HYMN" /> <hi rend="ital">Hercules in the Argonautic expedition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was carried off by the nymphs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and long sought for by Hercules in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:164" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:596" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 596</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 44</bibl> (where, by <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license, the <case>voc.</case> is scanned Hylā, Hȳl', like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)=ares, *)/ares</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:11:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 11, 15</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hylax: <entryFree id="n21138" type="main" key="Hy^lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <sense id="n21138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Barker</hi>, the name of a dog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyle: <entryFree id="n21139" type="greek" key="hy_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hȳlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/lh</foreign> (wood; hence), <sense id="n21139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">materials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>, Attei. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
hyles: <entryFree id="n21140" type="main" key="Hy_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳles</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 378</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyleus: <entryFree id="n21141" type="main" key="Hy^leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyleus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who took part in the Calydonian hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 312</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyllus: <entryFree id="n21142" type="main" key="Hyllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyllus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hȳlus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ullos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*(/ulos</foreign>, <sense id="n21142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Hercules by Dejanira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Iole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 279</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:508" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 508</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hylonome: <entryFree id="n21143" type="main" key="Hy_lo^no^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳlŏnŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ulono/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n21143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the beautiful wife of the centaur Cyllarus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:405 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 405 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hymen: <entryFree id="n21144" type="main" key="Hy_^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hȳ^men</orth>, <itype>ĕnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymĕnaeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(umh/n, *(ume/naios</foreign>, <sense id="n21144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of marriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of weddings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hymen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21144.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum illam educunt huc novam nuptam foras, suavi cantu concelebra omnem hanc plateam Hymenaeo! Io Hymen Hymenaee! Io Hymen!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">15 sq.: jam veniet virgo, jam dicetur Hymenaeus. Hymen o Hymenaee, Hymen ades o Hymenaee,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 5</bibl></cit> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(umh\n w)= *(ume/naie</foreign>); 62, 10 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: io Hymen Hymenaee io, Io Hymen Hymenaee,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 61, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:144" default="NO" valid="yes">144</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus Hymen Hymenaee vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid Hymen, quid Amor, quid sint conubia, curat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas Hymenaeus Amorque Praecutiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 758</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Hymenaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:429" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 429</bibl></cit>; 9, 762 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21144.2" n="B" level="2"> Derivv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymĕnēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hymen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hymeneal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, Mart. Cap. poët. 7, § 1: tripudia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, § 132 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21144.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21144.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A nuptial song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et subito nostras hymen cantatus ad aures Venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymenaeum qui cantent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 87</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymĕnāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(menai+ko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">hymeneal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to a nuptial song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> de Cent. Metr. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21144.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nuptials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wedding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymen funestus illaetabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 861" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 861</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubio jungam stabili propriamque dicabo: Hic hymenaeus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Helena) Pergama cum peteret inconcessosque hymenaeos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 651</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 328</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:283" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 283</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21144.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hymenaeus: <entryFree id="n21145" type="main" key="Hymenaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymenaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymeneï-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, see the preced. art.</entryFree>
hymettus: <entryFree id="n21146" type="main" key="Hy^mettus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymettus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(umhtto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain near Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for its honey and its marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 702</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:396" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 396</bibl> et saep.— In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attica (perh. of the region about Hymettus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21146.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymettĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Hymettus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hymettian</hi>: mel, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 240, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hymnidicus: <entryFree id="n21147" type="main" key="hymni^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hymnus + dico</etym>, <sense id="n21147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing hymns</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Carm. 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hymnio: <entryFree id="n21148" type="main" key="hymnio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>hymnus</etym>, <sense id="n21148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing hymns</hi> (post-class.): hymnite matres pro receptis parvulis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 118.</sense></entryFree>
hymnis: <entryFree id="n21149" type="main" key="Hymnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hymnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comedy of Cœcilius Statius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hymnisonus: <entryFree id="n21150" type="main" key="hymni^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hymnussonus</etym>, <sense id="n21150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing hymns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing praises</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 28, 230</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 200</bibl>; cf. the foll. word.</sense></entryFree>
hymnizo: <entryFree id="n21151" type="greek" key="hymni_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnīzo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(mni/zw, u(mne/w</foreign>, <sense id="n21151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing hymns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship by song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne illi in ignibus hymnizabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 33:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 33, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hymnodicus: <entryFree id="n21152" type="greek" key="hymno_di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnōdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(mnw|diko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">singing hymns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singing praises</hi>, Firm. Math. 8, 25; cf. the preced. and foll. artt.</sense></entryFree>
hymnologus: <entryFree id="n21153" type="greek" key="hymno^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(mnolo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n21153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singer of hymns</hi> or <hi rend="ital">praises</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 6; 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2617</bibl>. <cb n="HYPE" /></sense></entryFree>
hymnus: <entryFree id="n21154" type="greek" key="hymnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hymnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/mnos</foreign>, <sense id="n21154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a song of praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hymn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymnus cantus est cum laude Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 148:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 148, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Expos. Psa. 118</bibl>, prol. § 3; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 330, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 37 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinorum scriptor hymnorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 60</bibl> tit.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 26, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyophthalmos: <entryFree id="n21155" type="greek" key="hy^ophthalmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyophthalmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(o/fqalmos</foreign> (swine's eye), <sense id="n21155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Aster Atticus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyoscyaminus: <entryFree id="n21156" type="greek" key="hy^oscy^a^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyoscyămĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, =<foreign lang="greek">u(oskua/minos</foreign>, <sense id="n21156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of henbane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">henbane-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hyoscyamus: <entryFree id="n21157" type="greek" key="hy^oscy^a^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyoscyămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(osku/amos</foreign>, <sense id="n21157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb henbane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Apollinaris <hi rend="ital">and</hi> altercum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 17, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 3</bibl>.—In a corrupted form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">jusquiamus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyosiris: <entryFree id="n21158" type="greek" key="hy^o^si^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hyŏsĭris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(oseri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling endive;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, Centaurea nigra, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 64, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypaepa: <entryFree id="n21159" type="main" key="Hy^paepa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypaepa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/upaipa</foreign>, <sense id="n21159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Lydia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Beréki</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hy-paepēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypaethrus: <entryFree id="n21160" type="greek" key="hypaethrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypaethrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/paiqros</foreign>, <sense id="n21160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is in the open air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21160.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca (with aperta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21160.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n21160.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hy-paethros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a temple open</hi> or <hi rend="ital">without roof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21160.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hypaethrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an open building</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 50, 16, 242, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21160.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hypaethra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open walks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypallage: <entryFree id="n21161" type="greek" key="hy^palla^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypallăgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pallagh/</foreign>, <sense id="n21161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by which the relations of things seem to be mutually interchanged</hi> (as: <cit><quote lang="la">dare classibus austros instead of classes austris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hypanis: <entryFree id="n21162" type="main" key="Hy^pa^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/upanis</foreign>. <sense id="n21162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of European Sarmatia</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Boug</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 285</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21162.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 340</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypasis: <entryFree id="n21163" type="main" key="Hy^pa^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypăsis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyphăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/ufasis</foreign>, <sense id="n21163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Indus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sutledge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 21, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypata: <entryFree id="n21164" type="main" key="Hy^pa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(upa/th</foreign>, <sense id="n21164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Penēus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Neópatra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypătaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exsules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hypate: <entryFree id="n21165" type="greek" key="hy^pa^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypătē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pa/th</foreign>, <sense id="n21165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lowest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deepest string</hi> of a musical instrument, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> (as Greek, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 931</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
hypatius: <entryFree id="n21166" type="spur" key="hy^pa^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypătĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypasius</orth>, <itype>a false reading for Lasus</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 936</bibl>; v. Kopp ad loc.</entryFree>
hypatoides: <entryFree id="n21167" type="greek" key="hy^pa^to^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypătŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(patoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of musical modulation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 965 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

D. 3, 23, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21177.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21177.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyper-bŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hyperboreans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hyperborean</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, also i. q. <hi rend="ital">northern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 517</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:210" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septentrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus (gained over the Catti and Dacii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21177.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyper-bŏrĕānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same, Hier. ap. Chron. Euseb. ad Ann. 1560.</sense></entryFree>

hyperion: <entryFree id="n21182" type="main" key="Hy^pe^ri_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypĕrīon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uperi/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n21182.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of a Titan and the Earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of the Sun</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 192</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">241</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21182.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypĕ-rīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hyperion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> Avien. Arat. 396</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21182.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Sun</hi>: interea fugit albu' jubar Hyperionis cursum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 658</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 547 Vahl.); so Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 565</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:385" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 27</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hyperionis urbs, i. q. Heliopolis,</quote> <trans><tr>a city of Lower Egypt</tr>, <tr>with a temple of the Sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:406 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 406 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21182.3" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21182.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypĕ-rīŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:214" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21182.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypĕrīŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of the Sun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Hyperionide</hi>, said of Aurora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:159" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

hypochondria: <entryFree id="n21197" type="greek" key="hy^po^chondri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏchondrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(poxo/ndria, ta/</foreign>, <sense id="n21197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soft part of the body from the ribs to the groin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abdomen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> de Diaet. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypochyma: <entryFree id="n21198" type="greek" key="hy^po^chy^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏchyma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po/xuma</foreign>, <sense id="n21198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cataract in the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
hypochysis: <entryFree id="n21199" type="greek" key="hy^po^chy^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏchysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po/xusis</foreign>, <sense id="n21199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cataract in the eye</hi> (pure Lat. suffusio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 12, 91, § 143</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 35</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
hypocisthis: <entryFree id="n21200" type="greek" key="hy^po^cisthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏcisthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pokisqi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parasitic plant that grows on the cisthus</hi>: Asarum hypocistis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 31, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:81" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 48, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:177 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 16, 92, § 177 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hypocoriasis: <entryFree id="n21201" type="greek" key="hy^po^co^ri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏcŏrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pokori/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n21201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease under the pupil of the eye in cattle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypocorisma: <entryFree id="n21202" type="greek" key="hy^po^co^risma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏcŏrisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(poko/risma</foreign>, in gramm., <sense id="n21202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diminutive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 24</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
hypocrisis: <entryFree id="n21203" type="greek" key="hy^pocri^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypocrĭsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po/krisis</foreign>, <sense id="n21203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imitation of a person's speech and gestures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mimicry</hi>, Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21203.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hypocrisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended sanctity</hi> (eccl. Lat.), = pietatis simulatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypocrita: <entryFree id="n21204" type="greek" key="hy^pocri^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypocrĭta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(pokrith/s</foreign>. <sense id="n21204.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mime who accompanied the delivery of an actor by gestures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:7" default="NO">11, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21204.1" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a hypocrite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:12:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 12, 56 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

hypogeus: <entryFree id="n21209" type="greek" key="hy^po^ge_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏgēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po/gaios</foreign>, <sense id="n21209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:37:191" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 37, 191</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏgēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">hy-pŏgaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(po/geion</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">u(po/gaion</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a vault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cellar under ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a burying-vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1114, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Boëth. Art. Geom. p. 408, 20.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hy-pŏtēnūsālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the hypothenuse</hi>, Boëth. hypotheca: <entryFree id="n21224" type="greek" key="hy^po^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏthēca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(poqh/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n21224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi> (esp. of immovable things; whereas pignus is used of movable things; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: arra, arrabo),</quote> <trans><tr>a mortgage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:6:section=7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 6, § 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:2" default="NO">20, 1, 2</bibl> et saep. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 2</bibl>, written as Greek).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hypŏthēcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hypotheca</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a mortgage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

hypsa: <entryFree id="n21228" type="main" key="Hypsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Belici</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:228" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypsaeus: <entryFree id="n21229" type="main" key="Hypsaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of P. Plautius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypseus: <entryFree id="n21230" type="main" key="Hypseus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypseus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyll.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who was present at the nuptials of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypsicrates: <entryFree id="n21231" type="main" key="Hypsicra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypsicrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hypsipyle: <entryFree id="n21232" type="main" key="Hypsi^py^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypsĭpylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uyipu/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n21232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Thoas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">queen of Lemnos in the time of the Argonauts; she saved her father when the women killed all the men; she also entertained Jason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:739 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 739 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:90 sq" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 90 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hypsipyles patria,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lemnos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 399</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hypsĭpylēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lemnos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hypsoma: <entryFree id="n21233" type="greek" key="hypso_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hypsōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/ywma</foreign>, <sense id="n21233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyrcani: <entryFree id="n21234" type="main" key="Hyrca_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/urkanoi</foreign>, <sense id="n21234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hyrcanians on the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO">3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:474 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 474 al.</bibl> Macedones Hyrcani, <hi rend="ital">the Hyrcanians intermixed with Macedonians in Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21234.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21234.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Hyrcanians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hyrcanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Caspian Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit> (3, 28), 20: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:114" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 367</bibl></cit>: campus, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Macedones Hyrcani <hi rend="ital">in Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21234.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrcānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrcā-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Hyrcanians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hyrcania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyrgaletici: <entryFree id="n21235" type="main" key="Hyrga^le_ti^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrgălētĭci campi</orth>, <sense id="n21235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Hyrgaletic plains</hi>, on the borders of Phrygia and Caria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyrie: <entryFree id="n21236" type="main" key="Hy^ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(uri/h</foreign>, <sense id="n21236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and town situated by it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hyrieus: <entryFree id="n21237" type="main" key="Hy^ri^eus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrĭeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(urieu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor Bœotian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Orion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:499" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 499</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">535</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrĭēŭs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyrĭēa proles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Orion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:719" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 719</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hyrtacus: <entryFree id="n21238" type="main" key="Hyrta^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrtăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">father of Nisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 406</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21238.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hyrtă-cĭdes</orth>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Nisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:176 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 176 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:631" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 631</bibl>. <pb n="874" /> <cb n="IADE" /></sense></entryFree>
hysginum: <entryFree id="n21239" type="greek" key="hysgi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hysgĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/sginon</foreign>, <sense id="n21239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the darkred color obtained from the plant</hi> <foreign lang="greek">u(/sgh</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 26, 97, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:78:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 78, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hysopites: <entryFree id="n21240" type="greek" key="hy_so_pi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hȳsōpītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hysso-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(sswpi/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n21240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hyssop-wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hysopum: <entryFree id="n21241" type="greek" key="hy_so_pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hȳsōpum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hysso-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/sswpos</foreign>, <sense id="n21241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hyssop</hi>: Hyssopus officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 87, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:114" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11, 70, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:124" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 76, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperges me hyssopo, et mundabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:50:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 50, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—And in a form corresp. to the Gr., <orth extent="full" lang="la">hyssōpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Also scanned hȳsŏpum, Aemil. Mac. de Hyssopo.</sense></entryFree>
hystaspes: <entryFree id="n21242" type="main" key="Hystaspes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hystaspes</orth>, <itype>is or i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(usta/sphs</foreign>, <sense id="n21242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">father of the Persian king Darius I.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3</bibl>; Reg. 1.</sense></entryFree>
hystericus: <entryFree id="n21243" type="greek" key="hyste^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hystĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(steriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hysterical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:71:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 71, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:11" default="NO">11, 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hysterologia: <entryFree id="n21244" type="greek" key="hyste^ro^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hystĕrŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(sterologi/a</foreign>, a rhet. fig., <sense id="n21244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hysteron proteron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 816</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hystricosus: <entryFree id="n21245" type="main" key="hystri^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hystrĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hystrix</etym>, <sense id="n21245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi> (late Lat.), trop.: hystricosae et lividae mentis homo, Hier. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hystriculus: <entryFree id="n21246" type="main" key="hystri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hystrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n21246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearded</hi> (post-class.): hystriculus, <foreign lang="greek">dasu/prwktos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">pusio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit> dub. (al. striculus, ustriculus).</sense></entryFree>
hystrix: <entryFree id="n21247" type="greek" key="hystrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hystrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">histrix</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(/stric</foreign>, <sense id="n21247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a porcupine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 35, 53, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 4</bibl>. <cb n="I." /></sense></entryFree>
i: <entryFree id="n21248" type="main" key="I"><orth extent="full" lang="la">I</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">i</orth>, <itype>the ninth letter of the Latin alphabet</itype>, a vowel; for even the old grammarians distinguished it from the consonant written with the same character; see the letter J. The short <sense id="n21248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> is, next to <hi rend="ital">ë</hi>, the least emphatic of the Latin vowels, and serves, corresp. to the Gr. <hi rend="ital">o</hi>, as a connecting sound in forming compounds: aerĭfodina, aerĭpes, altitudo, altĭsonus, arcitenens, homĭcida, etc. It is often inserted in Latin words derived from Greek: mina, techina, cucinus, lucinus (for mna, techna, cycnus, lychnus, etc.); cf. Ritschl, Rhein. Mus. 8, p. 475 sq.; 9, p. 480; 10, p. 447 sq. And in similar manner inserted in arguiturus, abnuiturus, etc. The vowel <hi rend="ital">i</hi> is most closely related to <hi rend="ital">u</hi>, and hence the transition of the latter into the former took place not only by assimilation into a following <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, as similis, together with simul and simultas; facilis, together with facul and facultas; familia, together with famul and famulus; but also simply for greater ease of utterance; so that, from the class. per. onward, we find <hi rend="ital">i</hi> written in the place of the older <hi rend="ital">u</hi>: optimus, maximus, finitimus, satira, lacrima, libet, libido, etc., instead of the earlier optumus, maxumus, finitumus, satura, lacruma, lubet, lubido, etc.; cf. also the archaic genitives cererus, venerus, honorus, nominus, etc., for the later Cereris, Veneris, honoris, nominis, etc., the archaic orthography caputalis for capitalis, etc. For the relation of <hi rend="ital">i</hi> to <hi rend="ital">a</hi> and <hi rend="ital">e</hi>, see those letters. Examples of commutation between <hi rend="ital">i</hi> and <hi rend="ital">o</hi> are rare: -agnitus, cognitus, together with notus, ilico from in loco, the archaic forms ollus, ollic for ille, illic, and inversely, sispes and sispita for sospes and sospita. As an abbreviation, I (as the sign of the vowel <hi rend="ital">i</hi>) denotes in, infra, ipse, Isis, etc.: IDQ iidemque, I. H. F. C. ipsius heres faciendum curavit, IM. immunis, IMP. imperium, imperator, etc. The capital letter I is often confounded with the numeral I. (unus, primus).</sense></entryFree>
iacchus: <entryFree id="n21249" type="main" key="I^acchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭacchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/iakxos</foreign>. <sense id="n21249.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poetic and mystical appellation of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21249.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., like Bacchus, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Silenum) Inflatum hesterno venas, ut semper, Iaccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: multo madefactus, Col. poët. 10, 309.</sense></entryFree>
iadera: <entryFree id="n21250" type="main" key="I^a_de^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭādĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāder</orth>, <cb n="IAPY" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:140 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 21, 25, § 140 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 405</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n21250.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭādertīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> ladera, Auct. B. Alex. 42.</sense></entryFree>
iaera: <entryFree id="n21251" type="main" key="I^aera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭaera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/iaira</foreign>, the name of <sense id="n21251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Nereid</hi>, Hom. Il. 18, 42; but Lat. only as the name of <hi rend="ital">an Oread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woodnymph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sylvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 673</bibl></cit>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
ialysus: <entryFree id="n21252" type="main" key="I^a_ly^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭālysus-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/lusos</foreign>. <sense id="n21252.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of the fourth Sol</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">a famous picture of him by Protogenes, at Rhodes, afterwards in Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:31:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 31, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21252.1" n="II" level="1"> <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient city of Rhodes</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">village of Ialiso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 132</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n21252.2" n="B" level="2"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭālysĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of lalysus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telchines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 365</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iambelegus: <entryFree id="n21253" type="main" key="i^ambe^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭambĕlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)ambe/legos</foreign>, <sense id="n21253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of an iambic measure</hi> (diiambus) <hi rend="ital">hypercatalectic and a dactylic penthemimeris</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> de Cent. Met. 9, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iambeus: <entryFree id="n21254" type="greek" key="i^ambe_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭambēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)ambei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n21254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iambic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trimetri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 253</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iambicinus: <entryFree id="n21255" type="main" key="i^ambi^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭambĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>iambus</etym>, <sense id="n21255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iambic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 977 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
iambicus: <entryFree id="n21256" type="greek" key="i^ambi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭambĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)ambiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iambic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 473</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 516 sq.</bibl></cit>; ib. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
iamblichus: <entryFree id="n21257" type="main" key="I^ambli^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭamblĭchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/mblixos</foreign>, <sense id="n21257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Arabian emir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iambus: <entryFree id="n21258" type="greek" key="i^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/ambos</foreign>, <sense id="n21258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an iambic foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an iambus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21258.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:48" default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:80" default="NO">80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 473</bibl> P. et saep.— </sense><sense id="n21258.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an iambic poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iambic poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Hipponactis iambus laeserat aut qui erat Archilochi versu vulneratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 91</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:59" default="NO">59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iamidae: <entryFree id="n21259" type="main" key="I^a^mi^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭămĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the descendants of Iamus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Apollo</hi>, Cic. div. 1, 41, 91.</sense></entryFree>
iamphoryna: <entryFree id="n21260" type="main" key="I^ampho^ry_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭamphŏrȳna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-īna</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ynna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of the Mœdi in Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vrania</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ivorina</hi>, in the upper valley of the Moráva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ianthe: <entryFree id="n21261" type="main" key="I^anthe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭanthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Telestes</hi>, in Creta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:715 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 715 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ianthinus: <entryFree id="n21262" type="greek" key="i^anthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭanthĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)a/nqinos</foreign>, <sense id="n21262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">violet-blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 14, § 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭan-thĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, the color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:70:section=13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 70, § 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭanthĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">violet-colored garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:39:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 39, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ianthis: <entryFree id="n21263" type="greek" key="i^anthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭanthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)anqi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violetcolored flower</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iapetides: <entryFree id="n21264" type="main" key="I^a_pe^ti^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpĕtĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iapetus: <entryFree id="n21265" type="main" key="I_a^pe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăpĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iapeto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Titan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Uranos and Gœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Atlas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Prometheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Epimetheus</hi>, Hyg. F. praef.; 54; 142; 144; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 279</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 7 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satus Iapeto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Prometheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Iapeti genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21265.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăpĕtīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Iapetus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres gemini,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Prometheus and Epimetneus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 2, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iapis: <entryFree id="n21266" type="main" key="I^a_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the physician of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 391</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
