iapydes: <entryFree id="n21267" type="main" key="I^a_py^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpydes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/pudes</foreign>, <sense id="n21267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the present military frontier of Croatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21267.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n21267.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Iapydes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iapydis arva Timavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 475</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21267.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpydĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Iapydes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:108" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 108</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Iāpŭ-dia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 11</bibl> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
iapygeus: <entryFree id="n21268" type="main" key="Iapyge_u^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iapygēŭs</orth>, v. Iapyx, II. B. 3.</entryFree>
iapys: <entryFree id="n21269" type="main" key="Ia_pys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iāpys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype>, v. Iapydes, II. B.</entryFree>
iapyx: <entryFree id="n21270" type="main" key="I^a_pyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpyx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/puc</foreign>, <sense id="n21270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Dœdalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who ruled in Southern Italy</hi> (Apulia or Calabria), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21270.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21270.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river in the south of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21270.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wind that blows in the south of Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the west-northwest of the Greeks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 710</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21270.4" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpygĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that part of Southern Italy</hi> (Apulia <cb n="IASS" /> or Calabria) <hi rend="ital">over which Iapyx ruled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iapygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 703</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21270.5" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21270.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Iapygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acra,</quote> <trans><tr>a promontory on the eastern extremity of the Tarentine Gulf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 100</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21270.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpyx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Iapygian</hi>, also for <hi rend="ital">Apulian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Calabrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:707" default="NO">3, 707</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Garganus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 247</bibl></cit>: Daunus, as <hi rend="ital">king of Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">510</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21270.8" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāpygēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ventus), <hi rend="ital">the wind usually called</hi> Iapyx (v. supra), App. de Mundo, p. 63, 20.</sense></entryFree>
iarba: <entryFree id="n21271" type="main" key="I^arba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭarba</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Iarbas</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĭarbas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:552 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 552 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 45</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭarbī-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Mauritanian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 15</bibl>; cf. respecting him, Weichert: De Iarbita Timagenis aemulatore, Grimm. 1821.</sense></entryFree>
iardanis: <entryFree id="n21272" type="main" key="I^arda^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭardănis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Iardanus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Omphale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iasides: <entryFree id="n21273" type="main" key="I_a^si^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Iasius, II. B. b.</entryFree>
iasion: <entryFree id="n21274" type="main" key="I_a^si^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭon</orth>, v. 1. Iasius, I.</entryFree>
iasione: <entryFree id="n21275" type="greek" key="i_a^si^o_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īăsĭōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)asiw/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n21275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant bearing a white flower</hi>, perhaps <hi rend="ital">bind-weed</hi>: Convolvulus sepium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 65, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 39, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iasis: <entryFree id="n21276" type="main" key="I_a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. Iasius, II. B. c.</entryFree>
iasius: <entryFree id="n21277" type="main" key="I_a^si^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/sios</foreign>. <sense id="n21277.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Jupiter and Electra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved of Ceres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 25</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭon</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 423</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:300" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 300</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 270" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21277.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Argos and father of Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 70" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21277.2" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21277.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Iasius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iasian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Io</tr>, <tr>daughter of the Argive king Inachus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:353" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 353</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21277.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Iasius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palinurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 843</bibl></cit>; applied to <hi rend="ital">Adrastus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:541" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 541</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21277.5" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsis</orth>, <itype>idos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Iasius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21278" type="main" key="I_a^si^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īăsĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n21278.0" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Iasius;</hi> v. 1. Iasius, II. B. a.—</sense><sense id="n21278.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Iassus;</hi> v. Iassus, II. A.</sense></entryFree>
iason: <entryFree id="n21279" type="main" key="I^a_son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāson</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāso</orth> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/swn</foreign>. <sense id="n21279.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Jason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a famous Grecian hero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Æson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the leader of the Argonauts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sharer in the Calydonian boar-hunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Medea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards of Crĕūsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 301</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">348</bibl>; Val. Fl. et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 12:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo jam mercator Iason clausus et armatis obstat casa candida nautis, i. e. when the fresco in the portico of Agrippa, representing Jason and his sailors, is hidden by the white canvas tents of the dealers at the fancy fair,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:153 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 153 sq.</bibl></cit>—Also, <hi rend="ital">the name of a poem by Varro Atacinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 85.—</sense><sense id="n21279.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21279.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāsŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the ship Argo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 19), 45: <cit><quote lang="la">remige,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Argonautic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21279.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāsŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Jason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thoas and Euneus</tr>, <tr>sons of Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 340</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21279.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ruler of Pherœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iaspachates: <entryFree id="n21280" type="greek" key="i^aspa^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭaspăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)aspaxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n21280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of agate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper-agate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iaspideus: <entryFree id="n21281" type="main" key="i^aspi^de_u^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭaspĭdēŭs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>iaspis</etym>, <sense id="n21281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the jasper kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper - like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iaspis: <entryFree id="n21282" type="greek" key="i^aspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭaspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/aspis</foreign>, <sense id="n21282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a green - colored precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:20" default="NO">9, 60, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 261</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: vale (Maecenas), mel gentium, Cilniorum smaragde, iaspi figulorum, berylle Porsenae, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
iaspius: <entryFree id="n21283" type="main" key="i^aspi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭaspĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>iaspis</etym>, <sense id="n21283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of jasper</hi>: lapilli, Anth. Lat. 1, p. 413 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
iasponyx: <entryFree id="n21284" type="greek" key="i^aspo^nyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭaspŏnyx</orth>, <itype>ychis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)aspo/nuc</foreign>, <sense id="n21284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of jasper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jasper-onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iassus: <entryFree id="n21285" type="main" key="I^assus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭassus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iasso/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)ia=so/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient and wealthy town on the coast of Caria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Askem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Asyn Kalessi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8, 8, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21285.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21285.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭassĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Iassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iassian</hi>: sinus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1</bibl>, <pb n="875" /> <cb n="IBI" /> 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21285.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭas-senses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Iassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Iassians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iatralipta: <entryFree id="n21286" type="greek" key="i^a_tra^lipta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭātrălipta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)atralei/pths</foreign>, <sense id="n21286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a physician who cures by anointing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ointment-doctor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iatraliptice: <entryFree id="n21287" type="greek" key="i^a_tra^lipti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭātrăliptĭcē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭātrăleptĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)atraleiptikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n21287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of healing with ointments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ointment-cure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; cf. the preced. art.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭātrŏmēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)atro/maia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a female physician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">midwife</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iatronices: <entryFree id="n21288" type="greek" key="i^a_tro^ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭātrŏnīces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)atroni/khs</foreign>, <sense id="n21288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the conqueror of physicians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iarartes: <entryFree id="n21289" type="main" key="I^arartes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭarartes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iaca/rths</foreign>, <sense id="n21289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Central Asia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Syr-Daria</hi> (i. e. Yellow River), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
iazyges: <entryFree id="n21290" type="main" key="I^a_zy^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭāzyges</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jāzyges</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ia/zuges</foreign>, <sense id="n21290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sarmatian people on the Danube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:191" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iber: <entryFree id="n21291" type="main" key="Iber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iber</orth>, v. Hiberes.</entryFree>
iberes: <entryFree id="n21292" type="main" key="I^be_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭbēres</orth>, v. Hiberes.</entryFree>
iberis: <entryFree id="n21293" type="greek" key="i^be_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭbēris</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)bhri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 49, § 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iberus: <entryFree id="n21294" type="main" key="Ibe_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ibērus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hib-</orth>), <itype>a, um, and i</itype>, v. Hiberes, I. A. l. and ll.</entryFree>
ibex: <entryFree id="n21295" type="main" key="i_bex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ībex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chamois</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Job, 31, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ibi: <entryFree id="n21296" type="main" key="i^bi^_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭbĭ_</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from the pronom. root I, is, with <case>dat.</case> ending as in tibi, sibi, in loc. sense as in ubi; cf. Sanscr. suffix bhjam; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 169</etym>, <sense id="n21296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)ntau=qa</foreign> (cf. istic). </sense><sense id="n21296.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cenavi atque ibi quievi in navi noctem perpetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">tandem abii ad praetorem. Ibi vix requievi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: nempe in foro? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Ibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Asiam hinc abii, atque ibi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demaratus fugit Tarquinios Corintho et ibi suas fortunas constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 316</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificabat in summa Velia: ibi alto atque munito loco arcem inexpugnabilem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit haec differentia inter hoc edictum et superius, quod ibi de eo damno praetor loquitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:8:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 8, 4, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musca est meus pater ... nec sacrum nec tam profanum quicquamst, quin ibi ilico adsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illa, quae dicimus, non domo attulisse, sed ibi protinus sumpsisse videamur,</quote> <trans><tr>there</tr>, <tr>on the spot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:54" default="NO">4, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:19" default="NO">12, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo flumine pons erat. Ibi praesidium ponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—In common speech, sometimes pleonastic, with the name of a place: <cit><quote lang="la">in medio propter canalem, ibi ostentatores meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illic ibi demum'st locus, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—With corresp. relative adverbs, <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unde</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ubi tu profusus, ibi ego me pervelim sepultam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est, quin ubivis quam ibi, ubi est, esse malit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi esse, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tyrannus est, ibi ... dicendum est plane nullam esse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa intelleges meliora apud nos multo esse facta quam ibi fuissent, unde huc translata essent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">quo loco</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo loco maxime umor intus perseverabit, ibi pus proximum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quacumque equo invectus est, ibi haud secus quam pestifero sidere icti pavebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo descenderant, ibi processerunt longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi loci terrarum orbe portis discluso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—Post-class. of vessels, etc., <hi rend="ital">therein</hi> (= in eis): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sciens vasa vitiosa commodavit, si ibi infusum vinum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:18:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 18, § 3</bibl></cit>.—Post-class. and very rarely with verbs of motion (for eo): <cit><quote lang="la">et cum ibi venerimus,</quote> <trans><tr>there</tr>, <tr>thither</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. ibidem.—</sense><sense id="n21296.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21296.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi> (mostly ante - class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, but freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">invocat deos inmortales: ibi continuo contonat Sonitu maxumo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 41 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ... ibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ... ibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 39 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter conatus ibi collo dare bracchia circum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi infit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec moram ullam, quin ducat, dari: Ibi demum ita aegre tulit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>then for the first time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: ibi postquam laborare aciem Calpurnius vidit, Liv. <cb n="IBIS" /> 39, 31, 4.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cum alii mores et instituta eorum eluderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cum de re publica retulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—With corresp. <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ubi miser famelicus videt, me tam facile victum quaerere, ibi homo coepit me obsecrare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non voco (te patrem): Ubi voles pater esse, ibi esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—Pleonastically with <hi rend="ital">tum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ibi nescio quis me arripit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: ibi tum derepente ex alto in altum despexit mare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 518, 6</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 352 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Aebutius Caecinae malum minaretur, ibi tum Caecinam postulasse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi nunc (colloq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21296.4" n="B" level="2"> Of other relations, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that condition</hi> (class.): nolite ibi nimiam spem habere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid ego ibi peccavi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at pol ego ibi sum, esse ubi miserum hominem decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est, quod ad testes reservet, ibi nos quoque paratiores reperiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi fortunae veniam damus,</quote> <trans><tr>in that case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ab adulescentia bella intestina, caedes, rapinae, discordia civilis grata fuere, ibique juventutem suam exercuit,</quote> <trans><tr>in these things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non poterat ibi esse quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsensi illos ibi esse et id agere inter se clanculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to be at it</tr>, <tr>busy about it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cecinere vates, cujus civitatis eam civis Dianae immolasset, ibi fore imperium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in that state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi imperium fore, unde victoria fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et interdum in sanctionibus adicitur, ut qui ibi aliquid commisit, capite puniatur, i. e. in his sanctionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:9:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 9, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21296.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with him</hi> or <hi rend="ital">her</hi> (very rare): duxi uxorem; <cit><quote lang="la">quam ibi miseriam vidi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit> (cf.: ibi inquit, quasi uxor locus sit, Don. ad loc.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ibi majorum respectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21296.6" n="3" level="3"> Esp., law t. t.: tunc ibi, <hi rend="ital">then and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the state of affairs then existing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo, quaque ille tunc ibi habuit, tantummodo, intra annum ... judicium dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 16, 1 praef.</bibl></cit>; cf.: ibi autem ait praetor, ut ne quis et quae illic non habuit, complectatur, ib. § 37 sq.</sense></entryFree>
ibidem: <entryFree id="n21297" type="main" key="i^bi_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭbīdem</orth> (always ĭbĭdem in Plaut.; <sense id="n21297.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 19, 48</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ibi, with demonstr. suff. <hi rend="ital">dem</hi>, as in idem, tandem, tantundem, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">in the same place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in that very place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just there.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21297.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in space: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenta concidito minute et ibidem inarato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenati discubuerunt ibidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, cujus merces erant, in gladium ibidem incumberet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ibidem recte custodire poterunt, id ibidem custodiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hīc ibidem ante oculos vestros trucidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: ego ibidem has inter cenam exaravi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ibidem invenire fingimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 60</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. ibi, I.: <cit><quote lang="la">pede terram Crebra ferit: demissae aures, incertus ibidem Sudor, i. e. circa aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 500</bibl></cit>.—With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi amici, ibidem opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibidem divitiarum cupido est, ubi et usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si redierit Illa ad hunc, ibidem loci res erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—With a verb of motion (for eodem): <cit><quote lang="la">egomet me cum illis una ibidem traho,</quote> <trans><tr>I reckon myself among them</tr>, <tr>on the same plane with them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 166</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Quid, quod dedisti scortis? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Ibidem una traho, <hi rend="ital">to that very account</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21297.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21297.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">in that very moment</hi> (= paene eodem temporis momento): <cit><quote lang="la">Deinde ibidem homo acutus, cum illud occurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit> Madv.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ibidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibidem ilico puer abs te cum epistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21297.4" n="B" level="2"> Of other relations, <hi rend="ital">in the same matter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ibidem das. ubi tu tuom amicum adjuvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesit in eo Caecinam, sublevavit ibidem, i. e. in eo ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi non committitur aurum, vel si quando datur, custos affixus ibidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ibis: <entryFree id="n21298" type="greek" key="i_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ībis</orth>, <itype>is and ĭdis</itype> (<sense id="n21298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> ibes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50, 126</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> ibium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 49, § 142</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> ibidis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 57</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> ibidas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.; acc. sing.</hi> ibim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl>; <cb n="ICHN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 98</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)=bis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a bird held sacred by the Egyptians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which lived on water-animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ibis</hi>: Numenius ibis, Cuv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21298.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, Ibis, <hi rend="ital">the title of a satiric poem by Ovid</hi> (after Callimachus, who bestowed the name of Ibis on Apollonius of Rhodes).</sense></entryFree>
ibiscum: <entryFree id="n21299" type="main" key="i^biscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭbiscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. hibiscum.</entryFree>
ibrida: <entryFree id="n21300" type="main" key="i_bri^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ībrĭda</orth>, v. hibr-.</entryFree>
ibus: <entryFree id="n21301" type="main" key="ibus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ibus</orth>, v. is <sense id="n21301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ibycus: <entryFree id="n21302" type="main" key="I_by^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ībycus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ibukos</foreign>. <sense id="n21302.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek lyric poet of Rhegium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on account of the cranes which he called upon as witnesses of his murder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:152" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. de Hist. 12, 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n21302.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poor man</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icadius: <entryFree id="n21303" type="main" key="I_ca^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcădĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ika/dios</foreign>, <sense id="n21303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a notorious robber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcă-dĭon</orth>: Rhonches Icadionque cum dixit Lucilius cognomina piratarum posuit, Fest. s. v. rhondes, p. 270 Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: Icadion nomen saevissimi piratae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> ib.—</sense><sense id="n21303.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Apollo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 332</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icaria: <entryFree id="n21304" type="main" key="I_ca^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n21304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Icarian sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nicaria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcăros</orth> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icariotis: <entryFree id="n21305" type="main" key="I_ca^ri^o_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭōtis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, v. Icarus, II. B. 3.</entryFree>
icaris: <entryFree id="n21306" type="main" key="I_ca^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcăris</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, v. Icarus, II. B. 2.</entryFree>
icarus: <entryFree id="n21307" type="main" key="I_ca^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ikaros</foreign>. <sense id="n21307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Dœdalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on his flight from Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell into the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:195 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 195 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 40" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21307.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Icarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Icarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>the part of the Ægean Sea named after Icarus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭum</orth> (sc. mare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:283" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 283</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">566</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Icăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Sporades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.4" n="II" level="1"> =<foreign lang="greek">*)ika/rios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">son of Œbalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Sparta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Erigone and Penelope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placed in the heavens as the constellation</hi> Bŏōtes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 224" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl> (3, 31), 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 450</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 130" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.5" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n21307.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Icarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Icarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the vine</tr>, <tr>which Bacchus taught Icarus to cultivate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:147" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 147</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the vine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 655</bibl></cit>: boves, <hi rend="ital">the constellation</hi> Bŏōtes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl> (3, 31), 24: canis stella, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the constellation</hi> Canis Major (the dog of Icarus, named Mæra, which was translated to the sky), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">astrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:777" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 777</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: latratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 4, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ikari/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Icarus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Penelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:393" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 393</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21307.8" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcărĭōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ikariwti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Icarus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Penelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 10.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Penelope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:113" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
icas: <entryFree id="n21308" type="greek" key="i_cas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)ka/s</foreign> (the number twenty), <sense id="n21308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twentieth day of the month</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kept as a festival in honor of Epicurus</hi> (because Epicurus was born on the 20th of the month Gamelion), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 5</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus mensibus vicesimo die lunae dent ad eorum epulas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
iccirco: <entryFree id="n21309" type="main" key="iccirco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">iccirco</orth>, v. idcirco.</entryFree>
iccius: <entryFree id="n21310" type="main" key="Icci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iccĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10</bibl>. 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icciusportus: <entryFree id="n21311" type="spur" key="Iccius portus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Iccius portus</orth>, v. Itius.</entryFree>
icelos: <entryFree id="n21312" type="main" key="I^ce^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ĭcĕlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ikelos</foreign> (like), <sense id="n21312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Somnus</hi> (so called as producing dreams), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 640</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iceni: <entryFree id="n21313" type="main" key="Ice_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Icēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n21313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the southeastern part of Great Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the modern Kent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ichneumon: <entryFree id="n21314" type="greek" key="ichneumon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ichneumon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)xneu/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n21314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An animal which tracks the crocodile and destroys its eggs; the Egyptian rat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ichneumon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 24, 35, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 25, 37, § 90</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21314.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An insect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ichneumon-fly</hi>, Sphex sabulosus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:72" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 21, 24, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ichnobates: <entryFree id="n21315" type="main" key="Ichno^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ichnŏbătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ixnoba/ths</foreign> (that follows the trail), <sense id="n21315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ichnographia: <entryFree id="n21316" type="greek" key="ichnogra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ichnogrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)xnografi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n21316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ground-plot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>. <pb n="876" /> <cb n="ICTE" /></sense></entryFree>
ichnusa: <entryFree id="n21317" type="main" key="Ichnu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ichnūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ixnou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n21317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient name of the island of Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 358</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ichthyocolla: <entryFree id="n21318" type="greek" key="ichthy^o^colla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ichthyŏcolla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)xquo/kolla</foreign>. <sense id="n21318.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sturgeon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the huso</hi>, Acipenser huso, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21318.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The glue made from it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">isinglass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sturgeon-bladder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ichthyophagi: <entryFree id="n21319" type="main" key="Ichthy^o^pha^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ichthyŏphăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">i)xquofa/goi</foreign>, fish-eaters), <sense id="n21319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several nations living upon fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 25, § 95</bibl>; Greek <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Ichthyophagōn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icilius: <entryFree id="n21320" type="main" key="Icilius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Icilius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n21320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Sp. Icilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Icilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: lex Icilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
icio: <entryFree id="n21321" type="spur" key="i_^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ī^cĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ī^co</orth>), <itype>īci, ictum</itype> (forms in use, only <sense id="n21321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> icit, iciunt, icere; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> icit, icisse; <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> iceram, iceras; <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> icero; <hi rend="ital">pass. pres.</hi> icitur, icimur; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> ictus est; and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> ictus, a, um; <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> ĭco, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 886</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">but īcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 50</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> icio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 877</bibl> P.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i)p-, i)/ptomai</foreign>, to injure; <foreign lang="greek">i)/y</foreign>, a worm; <foreign lang="greek">i)/kria</foreign>, scaffolding; cf. <foreign lang="greek">*)/ikaros, e)n-iph/</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sting</hi> (cf.: ferio, percutio, verbero, pulso). </sense><sense id="n21321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n21321.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">exim corpus propellit et icit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde icimur ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1050" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1050</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput telis (musca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:116:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 116, 4</bibl></cit>: vidulum fuscinā, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Ptolemaeus in proelio telo venenato ictus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:66:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 66, 135</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi in turba ictus Remus, cecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ictus ab Hercule Cacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21321.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of lightning, etc., <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Summanus e caelo ictus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictae limen domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmine laurus sola non icitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen lauri fruticem non icit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in a figure, of a thunderbolt: ut vos iisdem ignibus circumsaepti me primum ictum pro vobis et fumantem videretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: exin candida se radiis dedit icta foras lux (i. e. Aurora), <hi rend="ital">struck with rays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irradiated</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 93 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n21321.4" n="C" level="2"> With a homogeneous object: Icere colaphum, <hi rend="ital">to give a box on the ear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hei, colaphum icit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21321.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21321.6" n="A" level="2"> In partic., icere foedus, like ferire and percutere foedus (v. ferio and percutio, I. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to make a covenant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">league</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus, quod meo sanguine in pactione provinciarum iceras, frangere noluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Gaditanis foedus icisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 886</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">orsi a foedere quod nobiscum icerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> 12, 62</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21321.7" n="B" level="2"> (Perh. not ante - Aug.) Desideriis icta fidelibus Quaerit patria Caesarem, <hi rend="ital">smitten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tormented</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novā re consules icti,</quote> <trans><tr>disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiā ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu icta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus quam pestifero sidere icti pavebant,</quote> <trans><tr>panic - stricken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestico vulnere ictus,</quote> <trans><tr>by family affliction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si existunt, qui magnitudinem multum ultra se positam non icturi appetant,</quote> <trans><tr>reach</tr>, <tr>attain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n21321.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltat Milonius, ut semel icto Accessit fervor capiti numerusque lucernis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>smitten with wine</tr>, <tr>tipsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
icon: <entryFree id="n21322" type="greek" key="i_con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)kw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n21322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictae ceră icones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iconicus: <entryFree id="n21323" type="greek" key="i_co^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)koniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitating a figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copied from life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <trans><tr>of the size of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
iconismus: <entryFree id="n21324" type="main" key="i_co^nismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcŏnismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)konismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representation by an image</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
iconium: <entryFree id="n21325" type="main" key="I_co^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īcŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)iko/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n21325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Lycaonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Koniyeh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 25, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icosaproti: <entryFree id="n21326" type="greek" key="i_co^sa^pro_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcŏsăprōti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)kosa/prwtoi</foreign>, <sense id="n21326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the twenty chief councilmen</hi> in the municipia and colonies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 26</bibl>; cf. decaproti and decemprimi.</sense></entryFree>
icosaprotia: <entryFree id="n21327" type="greek" key="i_co^sa^pro_tia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcŏsăprōtia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ei)kosaprwti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n21327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity of the</hi> icosaproti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icterias: <entryFree id="n21328" type="greek" key="icte^ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictĕrĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. gemma), = <foreign lang="greek">i)kteri/as</foreign>, <sense id="n21328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl>. <cb n="IDA" /></sense></entryFree>
ictericus: <entryFree id="n21329" type="greek" key="icte^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)kteriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill of the jaundice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:565" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 565</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ictĕrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">persons suffering with jaundice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 10, 23.</sense></entryFree>
icterus: <entryFree id="n21330" type="greek" key="icte^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/kteros</foreign>, <sense id="n21330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yellow bird</hi>, otherwise unknown, <hi rend="ital">the sight of which was said to cure the jaundice</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">i)/kteros</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 29, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ictis: <entryFree id="n21331" type="greek" key="ictis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)/ktis</foreign>, <sense id="n21331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of weasel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 16, § 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ictim tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ictus: <entryFree id="n21332" type="main" key="ictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21333" type="main" key="ictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n21333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> icti, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 17</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ico</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sting</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n21333.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n21333.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">a bestiis ictus, morsus, impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro ictu gladiatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ictu comminus neque conjectione telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis uno ictu pilorum transfixis et colligatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non caecis ictibus procul ex improviso vulnerabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictu scorpionis exanimato altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope funeratus Arboris ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus moenium cum terribili sonitu editi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 362</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 11, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbium servate pedem meique Pollicis ictum,</quote> <trans><tr>a striking</tr>, <tr>playing on the lyre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <trans><tr>the stroke of a wing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaethon ictu fulminis deflagravit,</quote> <trans><tr>a stroke of lightning</tr>, <tr>lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmineus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 618</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">beating rays</hi> of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">tum spissa ramis laurea fervidos Excludet ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:389" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 389</bibl></cit> (al. ignes): <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe Ejaculatur aquas atque ictibus aëra rumpit,</quote> <trans><tr>with jets of water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 124</bibl></cit>: saxaque cum saxis et habentem semina flammae Materiem jactant, ea concipit ictibus ignem, <hi rend="ital">by their blows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">collision</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21333.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n21333.4" n="1" level="3"> In prosody or in music, <hi rend="ital">a beating time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a beat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pedum et digitorum ictu intervalla signant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulantium pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde etiam trimetris accrescere jussit Nomen iambeis, cum senos redderet ictus Primus ad extremum similis sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21333.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A beat of the pulse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus creber aut languidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21333.6" n="3" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21333.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shot</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sublata erat de foro fides, non ictu aliquo novae calamitatis, sed suspicione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illum habet ictum, quo pellat animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ictu nostro positum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in our power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stare sub ictu Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua innocentia sub ictu est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in imminent danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. the opposite: Deum extra ictum sua divinitas posuit, <hi rend="ital">beyond shot</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">out of danger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem ictu temporis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis veluti ictibus bella transigere,</quote> <trans><tr>by separate attacks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (legiones) si amnem Araxen ponte transgrederentur, sub ictum dabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>would have come to close quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>;
