cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetis ostentat ad Urbem Per campos superesse vim, Romamque sub ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>near at hand</tr>, <tr>before the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:42" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21333.8" n="B" level="2"> (Cf. icio, II. A.) Ictus foederis, <hi rend="ital">the conclusion of a treaty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
icuncula: <entryFree id="n21334" type="hapax" key="i_cuncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īcuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>icon</etym>, <sense id="n21334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small image</hi> or <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ida: <entryFree id="n21335" type="main" key="I_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ida</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*)/idh</foreign>. <sense id="n21335.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A high mountain in Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the infant Jupiter was hid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watched over by the Curetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and fed by Amalthea;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Psiloriti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 115 al.</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:1:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 1, 27</bibl>, this mountain and <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. are confounded.—</sense><sense id="n21335.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ida</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Idean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ida</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dactyli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same, Digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bustum,</quote> <trans><tr>raised by the Cretans to Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:35:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21335.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A high mountain in Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Troy</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Ida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 801</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 71</bibl>; and 12, 521 (Ide) et saep.—</sense><sense id="n21335.3" n="B" level="2"> <cb n="IDCI" /> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount lda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Idean;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 535</bibl>: parens deum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cybele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was worshipped on Mount Ida</hi> (acc. to others this belongs to Mount Ida of Crete), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:182" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sollemne,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in honor of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 112</bibl></cit>: judex, i. e <hi rend="ital">Paris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospes numinis Idaei, i. e. Scipio Nasica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 138</bibl></cit>: cinaedus, <hi rend="ital">Ganymede</hi> as stolen away from Ida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>Phrygian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Trojan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Romans descended from the Trojans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>. —Confounded with Idaeus, I. B.: Idaeum Simoënta Jovis cum prole Scamandro, Prop 3 (4), 1, 27.—</sense><sense id="n21335.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan female</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
idaeus: <entryFree id="n21336" type="main" key="I_daeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n21336.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art. I. B. and II. B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n21337" type="main" key="I_daeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n21337.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A herald and charioteer of Priam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 485</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21337.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 500</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
idalium: <entryFree id="n21338" type="main" key="I_da^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdălĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)ida/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n21338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountaincity in Cyprus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Venus;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Dalin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 681</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 693</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 52</bibl> (where domus is <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>, not <number>plur.</number>; v. Wagn. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n21338.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Idalium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Idalian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also for <hi rend="ital">Cyprian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <trans><tr>the Idalian mountain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:54" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 54</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 38 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 5:760" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 59: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dart of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <trans><tr>doves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 372</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cyprian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdălĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Venus.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 694</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
idas: <entryFree id="n21339" type="main" key="I_das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/idas</foreign>. <sense id="n21339.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Aphareus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Messene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who took part in the Calydonian boar-hunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:701" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 701</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21339.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 504</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21339.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One slain in the wedding of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 90</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21339.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 575</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21339.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Thracian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 351</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
idcirco: <entryFree id="n21340" type="main" key="idcirco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">idcirco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">iccirco</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id-circa</etym>, <sense id="n21340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for that reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: itaque, igitur, ergo; ideo, propterea; quare, quam ob rem, etc.). </sense><sense id="n21340.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco moneo vos ego hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Cliniae servos tardiusculus est: Idcirco huic nostro tradita'st provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod id quod factum sit, aliud alii videatur esse, et idcirco alius alio nomine id appellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 42, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">data Romanis venia est indigna poëtis. Idcircone vager scribamque licenter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et idcirco disceptatione sublata pellitur e medio sapientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21340.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rel.</hi> (so most freq.). </sense><sense id="n21340.3" n="A" level="2"> Corresp. to causal sentences, with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco arcessor, nuptias quod mihi apparari sensit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant, sapientem idcirco virum bonum esse, quod eum sua sponte bonitas delectet, sed quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco quidam, comoedia necne poëma Esset, quaesivere, quod acer spiritus ac vis Nec verbis nec rebus inest, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia natura mutari non potest, idcirco verae amicitiae sempiternae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco, judices, quia veram causam habebam, brevi peroravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:48:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 48, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim, quia movetur qui ingreditur, idcirco qui movetur ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:2" default="NO">2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco enumerabimus, non quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 38</bibl>: meminerimus idcirco te in istam provinciam missum, quoniam, etc., Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 32</bibl> (41); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec idcirco, quoniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:92" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:1:10:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 1, 10, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si Opimium defendisti, idcirco te isti bonum civem putabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim, si Cicero recte sentinam reipublicae dixit ... idcirco probem illud quoque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si pugnent inter se ... idcirco ars non erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, si te validus jactaverit auster in alto. Idcirco navem trans Aegaeum mare vendas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">si</hi> omitted: non possis oculo quantum contendere<pb n="877" /> <cb n="IDEM" />  Lynceus: <cit><quote lang="la">Non tamen idcirco contemnas lippus inungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n21340.4" n="B" level="2"> With a clause denoting the <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco nemo superiorum attigit, ut ipse tolleret, Cic Verr. 2, 4, 4, § 7: quae ut fieret, idcirco pugnatum esse arbitror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum prooemium idcirco comparatum sit, ut judex fiat conciliator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si idcirco fieret, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § 27; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 2, 12: sese idcirco ab suis discedere noluisse, quo facilius civitatem in officio contineret, ne omnis nobilitatis discessu plebs propter imprudentiam laberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos suspicarier, Me idcirco haec tanta facinora promittere, Qui vos oblectem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco capite et superciliis semper est rasis, ne ullum pilum viri boni habere dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcircone nobilitas rem publicam reciperavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco ut possim linguam contemnere servi, utile consilium dedisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
idea: <entryFree id="n21341" type="greek" key="i^de^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ide/a</foreign>, <sense id="n21341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Platonic</hi>) <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archetype</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 58</bibl>, as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
idealis: <entryFree id="n21342" type="main" key="i^de^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>idea</etym>, <sense id="n21342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">existing in idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ideal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam prudentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, § 816 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
idem: <entryFree id="n21343" type="main" key="i_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īdem, ĕădem</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ĭdem</orth> (<sense id="n21343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">eidem</orth>, freq. in MSS. and inscrr.; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 120</bibl>; rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">isdem</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">eisdem</orth>; <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> eidem; <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> eisdem; usu. contr. idem, isdem; not iidem, iisdem; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 198 sqq.), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> [from the pronom. root <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, whence <hi rend="ital">is</hi>, and the demonstr. suff. <hi rend="ital">dem;</hi> root of dies, day, time; hence, just, exactly, Corss. Aussp. 2, 855], <hi rend="ital">the same.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21343.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde quod nos eadem Asia atque idem iste Mithridates initio belli Asiatici docuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (sphaeram) ab eodem Archimede factam posuerat in templo Virtutis Marcellus idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, quod eidem Ciceroni placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure erat semper idem vultus (Socratis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem semper vultus eademque frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem eodem modo omnes causas ages? aut in iisdem causis perpetuum et eundem spiritum sine ulla commutatione obtinebis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 31, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod alia res esset: immo eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si verbo differre videbitur, re tamen erit unum et omnibus in causis idem valebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad causas simillimas inter se vel potius easdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 94, 324</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n21343.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., idem is used, </sense><sense id="n21343.3" n="A" level="2"> When two predicates are referred to the same subject. </sense><sense id="n21343.4" n="1" level="3"> When the predicates are of the same kind it may often be rendered, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, etc., or = is (ea, id) with <hi rend="ital">quoque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simul</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Academico et eodem rhetore congredi conatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio splendida et grandis et eadem in primis faceta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avunculus meus, vir innocentissimus idemque doctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam M. Marcellus ille quinquies consul totum (auspicium) omisit, idem imperator, idem augur optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Xenocrates, ubi Aristoteles ista tetigit? hos enim quasi eosdem esse vultis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viros fortes, magnanimos, eosdem bonos et simplices esse volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caninius idem et idem noster cum ad me pervesperi venisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus est tamquam alter idem,</quote> <trans><tr>a second self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad idem semper exspectandum paratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam idem velle atque idem nolle, ea demum firma amicitia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos omnes eadem odisse, eadem metuere in unum coeëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hisdem diebus, for eisdem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic finis belli, ... idemque finis regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ab condita urbe Roma ad captam urbem eandem Romani ... gessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pars militum gladiatores, qui e servitio Blaesi erant, pars ceteram ejusdem familiam vincirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erepta mihi prius eorundem matre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">fervida aestas, longinqua itinera sola ducis patientia mitigabantur, eodem plura quam gregario milite tolerante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21343.5" n="2" level="3"> When the predicates are in contrast with one another it may be rendered, <hi rend="ital">nevertheless</hi>, <cb n="IDEN" /> <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Epicurus) cum optimam et praestantissimam naturam dei dicat esse, negat idem esse in deo gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:section=121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, § 121</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21343.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n21343.7" n="1" level="3"> Connected or corresp. with the pronouns <hi rend="ital">ego</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ille</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>, and with <hi rend="ital">unus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem ego ille (non enim mihi videor insolenter gloriari, etc.) idem inquam ego recreavi afflictos animos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego idem, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitae sunt multae de me contiones ... habuit de eodem me P. Lentulus consul contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo nunc ejusdem illius inimici mei de me eodem contionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">108: de me eodem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu igitur concedis idem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Mos.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoram te in custodia salutis meae diligentem: eundemque te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sopater quidam fuit, etc. ... huic eidem Sopatro eidem inimici ad C. Verrem ejusdem rei nomen detulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est idem hic Sopater absolutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">70: hoc idem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hisce eisdem permotionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem ille tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eisdem illis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem illam (sphaeram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum et idem qui consuerunt et idem illud alii desiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem iste Mithridates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit> (Klotz, Orell., B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">older edd., idem ipse): musici qui erant quondam idem poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 174</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficentia, quam eandem benignitatem appellari licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem in ceteris artibus non fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus quidem omnium unus et idem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 47, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (causa) omnes sentirent unum atque idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in an inverted order: ut verset saepe multis modis eandem et unam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego aliter accepi: intellexi tamen idem, non existimasse te, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21343.8" n="2" level="3"> As a word of comparison, with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">que</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qui</hi> (<hi rend="ital">quae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>), <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, or (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) with the <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">the same as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">identical with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the same meaning as</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeratur, idemne sit pertinacia et perseverantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: videmus fuisse quosdam, qui idem ornate ac graviter, idem versute et subtiliter dicerent, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi> and <hi rend="ital">as well as</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 18, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii nostri terrarumque idem est extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem habitam non quasi narrantes exponimus, sed eisdem fere verbis, ut actum disputatumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem abeunt, qui venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam earum rerum quas ego gessi, non est eadem fortuna atque condicio, quae illorum qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo idem sit servulus quod familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (servi) et moribus eisdem essent, quibus dominus, et eodem genere ac loco nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem constituit potestatem quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem loco res est, quasi ea pecunia legata non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensu amisso fit idem, quasi natus non esset omnino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi mecum in eodem est pistrino vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc eodem mecum patre genitum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eadem mecum Africa geniti fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28, 14</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Homerus) Sceptra potitus, eadem aliis sopitu' quiete est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1038</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">invitum qui servat idem facit occidenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 467</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 4, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non idem illis censuissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille eadem nobis juratus in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 50</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si idem nos juris haberemus quod ceteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi idem consilii do, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui ubique idem operis efficiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habet officii lucifer omnis idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: eādem, eodem, v. h. v.</sense></entryFree>
identidem: <entryFree id="n21344" type="main" key="i^denti^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdentĭdem</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">idem-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>idem + ti (= <foreign lang="greek">e)/ti</foreign>) + dem (root dies), v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 456; 855</etym>, <sense id="n21344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">several times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at intervals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever and anon; continually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitually</hi> (class.; cf.: subinde, interdum): ne te uxor sequatur, respectas identidem, Plant. Men. 1, 2, 51; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego admirans, referebam tamen oculos ad terram identidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: scindens dolore<cb n="IDEO" />  identidem intonsam comam, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitato identidem, tibi quam fidelis fuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quaeso identidem circumspice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Chalcidico Euripo in motu identidem reciprocando putas fleri posse constantius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae aptissime factae ad claudendas pupulas et ad aperiendas, idque providit ut identidem fieri posset cum maxima celeritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cassius identidem in causa quaerere solebat, cui bono fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis identidem armis novos hostes exsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum identidem interrogaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revolvor identidem in Tusculanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 18, 27</bibl>: cum se illi identidem in silvas ad suos reciperent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum amans vere, sed identidem omnium Ilia rumpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum identidem legem Aemiliam recitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 44, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc identidem nosmet ipsi instemus. Res enim communis agitur, ut frequenter et assidue consequamur artis rationem studio et exercitatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omne id tempus suspensos ita tenuit animos ... ut identidem jam in urbem futurus videretur impetus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi currum vehentes identidem (habenis) verberabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ideo: <entryFree id="n21345" type="main" key="i^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĕo</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id-eo, i. e. this for this</etym>, <sense id="n21345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for that reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">therefore</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Quint.; cf.: eo, idcirco; ergo, igitur, itaque). </sense><sense id="n21345.1" n="I" level="1"> Relatively. </sense><sense id="n21345.2" n="A" level="2"> With causal particles, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quoniam.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21345.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo quod plerique deducuntur ad molas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re quidem ipsa ideo mihi non satis facio, quod nullam partem tuorum meritorum consequi possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ideo quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 14, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me foliis ideo brevioribus ornes, Quod timui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel ideo, quod exercere potest utrimque judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO">10, 5, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo quia uxor ruri est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ideo quia, introducing a reason,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Off. 1, 30, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mulieres ideo bene olere quia nihil olebant, videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ideo felicia bella vestra esse, quia justa sint, prae vobis fertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec medicina ideo non erit ars, quia unctio ... cum coquorum ei sit arte communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ideo nondum est perfectus orator, non solum quia aliud in alio magis eminet, sed quod non una omnibus forma placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">competit enim actio, non ideo, quia nunc abest, sed quia umquam beneficio furis abfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi>: ideo supervacaneum esse contendunt, quoniam comprehensibilis natura est, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnia ideo noscenda sunt, quoniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immo ideo magis propera, quoniam id nunc aggressus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 200</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ideo adjectum est, quoniam multa genera sunt missionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.6" n="B" level="2"> With intentional particles, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n21345.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (alvos) ideo videntur medias facere angustissimas, ut figuram imitentur earum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo C. Claudius Pulcher retulit, ut C. Verres posset auferre?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:4:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ideo rationem subjecimus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero nunc ideo disputabo, quod hunc statum rei publicae non magnopere defendendum putem ... sed, ut doceam Rullum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non ideo excuso, quia non probem, sed ut sint magis admirabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ideo aliquid contra mulieres scripsit, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideoque decemviros conubium diremisse, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen omittenda, vel ideo, ne occupentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ideo Rhenum insedimus, ut Italiam tueremur, sed ne quis alius Ariovistus regno Galliarum potiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n21345.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod id ideo facerent, quo facilius deminuerent hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 90</bibl></cit> Müll. —* </sense><sense id="n21345.10" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, quin breviter reddi responsum potuerit, non recipi reges, ideo potius delectos patrum ad eum missos, quam, etc., sed ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Non</hi> (<hi rend="ital">nec</hi>) <hi rend="ital">ideo</hi>, with conditional particle <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <pb n="878" /> <cb n="IDOL" /> or referring to an <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: non, si non potuero indagare, eo ero tardior; <cit><quote lang="la">sed velocior ideo si quivero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrae sapientiae est, judices, non, si causa justa est viris fortibus oppugnandi M. Caelium, ideo vobis quoque vos causam putare esse justam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">his et talibus recitatis,... non ideo Thrasea decessit sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen tempestate fuerit abreptus, non ideo minus erit gubernator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:34" default="NO">5, 11, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21345.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">te velle uxorem aiebat tuo nato dare, Ideo aedificare hoc velle aiebat in tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: ex illa investigatione naturae consequi volebat, bono ut esset animo. Ideo enim ille summum bonum <foreign lang="greek">eu)qumi/an</foreign> appellat, etc., <hi rend="ital">it was for this reason that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo conducta Paulus agebat sardonyche,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 143</bibl></cit>: nam ideo dictus <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rwn</foreign>, agens imperitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil laboras: ideo, cum opus est, nihil habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ideo ad Pompeium contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nemo ministro fur erit, atque ideo nulli comes exeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:23" default="NO">7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:251 al" default="NO">8, 251 al.</bibl>; so, ideoque, Quint. prooem. § 9; 25; 1, 4, 19; 1, 5, 42; 1, 6, 22 et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ideoque et medius ille orationis modus maxime convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:4:13" default="NO">7, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbat id sine rege Persarum non posse fieri, ideoque eum amicum sibi cupiebat adjungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideoque necesse est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 490</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:495" default="NO" valid="yes">495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:678 al" default="NO" valid="yes">678 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerandum est, num cui saepius horum aliquid eveniat, neque ideo corporis ulla difficultas subsequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ideo iram ejus lenient = nec tamen ideo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen his ulla umquam opsonia fiunt rancidula, aut ideo pejor gallina secatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
idiographus: <entryFree id="n21346" type="greek" key="i^di^o^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĭŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, =<foreign lang="greek">i)dio/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n21346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">written with one's own hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber Vergilii,</quote> <trans><tr>autograph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
idioma: <entryFree id="n21347" type="greek" key="i^di^o_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĭōma</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)di/wma</foreign>, <sense id="n21347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peculiarity in language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idiom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 255</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
idiota: <entryFree id="n21348" type="greek" key="i^di^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)diw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n21348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an uneducated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common person</hi> (cf. rudis): quidni et tu idem illitteratum me atque idiotam diceres? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 38, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non modo istum hominem ingeniosum atque intelligentem, verum etiam quemvis nostrum, quos iste idiotas appellat, delectare possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos nobis idiotis relinquet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam rem paternam ab idiotarum divitiis ad philosophorum regulam perduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam respondere nos tibi non quimus, quos idiotas et rudes vocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idiotae,</quote> <trans><tr>the common throng</tr>, <tr>the fickle mass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
idioticus: <entryFree id="n21349" type="greek" key="i^di^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)diwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uneducated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rudem, impolitam et idioticam compellare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Testim. An. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
idiotismus: <entryFree id="n21350" type="greek" key="i^di^o_tismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭdĭōtismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">i)diwtismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n21350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vulgar manner of speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3 praef.</bibl> § 5; 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
idistaviso: <entryFree id="n21351" type="main" key="Idistaviso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Idistaviso</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Idisiaviso</orth> <etym>the latter form ex conj. Grimm; Germ. from Idisi, maiden, and Viso, meadow; cf. Grimm, Deutsche Mythol. p. 372 ed. II., qs. <hi rend="ital">the maiden's meadow;</hi> is approved by Nipperd. ad loc., and has been adopted in the text by Halm; the MS. form, explained as <hi rend="ital">splendid meadow</hi>, from ancient Germ. id = nitens, the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of which is idista, Grimm, Gram. Einl. p. xlii, is retained by Ritter</etym>, <sense id="n21351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plain bordering on the Visurgis</hi>, (the modern <hi rend="ital">Weser</hi>); perh. near the modern <hi rend="ital">Minden</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
idmon: <entryFree id="n21352" type="main" key="Idmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Idmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/idmwn</foreign>. <sense id="n21352.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Arachne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Colophon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21352.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Idmŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related to Idmon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Idmonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arachne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n21352.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prophet in Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Apollo and Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:506" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 506</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n21352.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Rutulian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">messenger of Rutulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n21352.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The physician of Adrastus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Epidaurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:398" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 398</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
